name: Prologue
text:
|| SECTION: 01_Intro

Mellka [5]: Ghalt? You read me?

Ghalt [15]: Loud and clear, Mellka. Welcome to Tempest – the heart of what's left of the Jennerit Imperium. Glad you could join us.

Mellka [20]: Hey, I owed you one. That and I'm never one to turn down a shot at crapping all over Rendain's plans. Where's the defector?

Ghalt [35]: Setting up the pyrotechnics for today's big event. We got one shot at this job, Mell – you ready?

Mellka [50]: Of course I'm not sure. But screw it! Let's get it done!

Mellka [55]: Nope! But to hell with it, let's get it done!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_SpawnIntro

Ghalt [10]: Get to the rendezvous point. Find Deande.

Ghalt [20]: Upload the mission data to Mellka's rig, Kleese.

Kleese [30]: Already on it, Captain!

Mellka [40]: Wait a minute, is that... ugh, that's Kleese, isn't it? You brought KLEESE on this mission.

Kleese [50]: Ah, there you are! Just follow the waypoint I've uploaded. It should lead you straight into the GAPING MAW OF DEATH ITSELF. (chuckle) Thrilled to see you too, Mellka.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_Checkpoint1

Mellka [1]: Ghalt, I got a great idea. Nevermind the defector, let's just kill Rendain now. Awesome plan, right? You're excited to be a part of it, et cetera?

Kleese [2]: Oh, it's that simple, is it? My word, I had no idea! Let's do that instead!

Ghalt [3]: The Heliophage is the most fortified location in Solus. You'd never get close. That's why we need the defector. We need Deande.

Kleese [10]: Given that today's mission is wildly dangerous, I'd recommend syncing with an LLC emergency transport beacon – or checkpoint, in dummy parlance. There's one close by.

Kleese [20]: Once synced with your rig, the beacon instantly transports you away from battle if your vitals drop too low.

Mellka [30]: So what's the catch? It's LLC tech, right? There's gotta be a catch.

Ghalt [35]: The catch is, our contract with the LLC only guarantees a limited number of emergency transports before we're cut off. (scoff) Greedy bastards.

Kleese [50]: Business-savvy bastards, Captain. Nothing's free at the LLC.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03a_StarActivity

Mellka [10]: Oh, man – Solus isn't lookin' so hot.

Kleese [20]: It's in the final throes of its Darkening. In a few hours, Solus will be dragged into the void – with the Varelsi pulling on one side, the Jennerit pushing on the other.

Mellka [30]: Let's hope this defector friend of yours knows what she's doing, Ghalt. If she fails, the Last Star is hosed-

Kleese [40]: And all conscious life perishes in an infinitely dark universe!

Ghalt [50]: Thanks, Kleese.

Kleese [60]: What? Did I say something wrong?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_Combat1

Mellka [10]: The hell's up with those M1 units?

Kleese [20]: Defective units. Ugh, how sloppy – were I still in charge of Minion Robotics, I'd have someone's ass for this.

Ghalt [35]: Take 'em out just in case. Don't want any of those things phoning home and blowing the big surprise.

Mellka [40]: I'm on it.

Mellka [50]: Ooh, I LIKE this gun. Where'd you get it, Captain?

Ghalt [65]: It's a modded UPR machine pistol. Kleese's handiwork, actually.

Kleese [70]: Yes! It's designed to work in conjunction with your horrific disfigurement.

Mellka [80]: It's an Eldrid biogauntlet, Kleese.

Kleese [90]: You say tomato, I say horrific disfigurement. Go on, give it a try.

Mellka [100]: AGGGGHHH!

Mellka [100]: —Oh. I'm... I'm alive.

Kleese [110]: Saved by the checkpoint beacon – and lucky for you, the first one's free! Oh-oh, okay – THAT and the HEALTH are free. But I promise you, NOTHING ELSE!

Kleese [113]: Saved by the checkpoint beacon. And lucky for you, the first one's free.

Mellka [115]: I thought NOTHING was free at the LLC.

Mellka [115]: Heh. That rhymes.

Kleese [118]: Fine. SOME things are free at the LLC. Such as your first emergency teleport. BUT LITERALLY NOTHING ELSE!

Ghalt [120]: Haven't lost a step. Keep moving.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04a_ClawTraining

Ghalt [10]: See any way through that door?

Mellka [20]: I see an access panel. I'll, y'know, hack it.

Ghalt [30]: You mean shoot it, don't you?

Mellka [40]: What? Don't be stupid, captain. I'm gonna PUNCH it!

Ghalt [60]: You havin' some trouble down there, kid?

Mellka [70]: Hang on, I'm just... y'know, just... I'm screwing around. Sorry. Claw Lunge. On it.

Mellka [80]: That'll do, scary monster arm.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04a_ClawTraining_1A

Ghalt [50]: That panel is aggressively shielded. To get around it, you'll need to hit it harder and faster. Try your Claw Lunge.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04a_ClawTraining_1B

Mellka [50]: Not gonna get through that shield with just the gun. I better try my Claw Lunge.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04a_ClawTraining_1C

Kleese [50]: Hit it with a Claw Lunge, Mellka!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04a_ClawTraining_1D

Ghalt [50]: You got to hit it harder and faster if you wanna break through that shielding. Try your Claw Lunge, Mell.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04b_SpikeTraining

Ghalt [10]: Damn – bridge is out. There's gotta be some way to power it up.

Mellka [20]: Power it up? Psh! I say “psh” to that! Screw powering the bridge – I'll just Spike myself up there. Stand by.

Mellka [40]: By the way, Ghalt? In the ancient Eldrid tongue, “psh” means “I got it covered”. FYI.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04b_SpikeTraining_1A

Ghalt [30]: Give your Spike a try. See if that'll get you up there.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04b_SpikeTraining_1B

Kleese [30]: Oh! Mellka, I know! Do the thing you said you'd do a second ago. Spike yourself aloft!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04b_SpikeTraining_1C

Mellka [30]: Just gotta Spike myself up there. This'll be easy AND fun!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05_RendezvousRoute

Mellka [10]: So, just who is the defector, anyway?

Ghalt [20]: Oh, I didn't tell you? Get this: it's Deande. Spymaster of the Jennerit Imperium.

Mellka [30]: Holy crap, seriously? Rendain's right hand?

Ghalt [40]: Pretty crazy, right? She's been leading the Jennerit resistance ever since the Lord Commander's rise to power. And those intel drops we've been getting? Those were her, too.

Mellka [50]: And you're SURE we can trust her?

Ghalt [60]: I guess we're about to find out. Get moving. You're not far from the Heliophage.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_Heliphage

Deande [10]: Ghalt? Are we ready to go?

Ghalt [20]: We're set. Mellka's nearly at the rendezvous point.

Deande [30]: Good, because I'm about to commit my second act of treason for the day!

Kleese [40]: Energy surge at the Heliophage... this is it! Popcorn at the ready, everyone! The show's about to start!

Kleese [50]: PAHAHAH! SUCK IT, RENDAIN!

Ghalt [55]: Beautiful. That should buy us some time. Now we gotta get Deande outta here. Hurry to the rendezvous point!

Rendain [60]: All forces: one of our own has betrayed us. Bring me the spymistress! BRING ME DEANDE!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_Rendevous

Nova [10]: Atmospheric anomalies detected. Shardstorm imminent.

Ghalt [20]: Damn – hurry it up, Deande!

Deande [30]: Almost there!

Deande [40]: Hi. I'm Deande. And, uh, you are?

Ghalt [50]: Get her on her feet! We gotta move!

Ghalt [70]: There's a checkpoint beacon nearby – get her over there.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_Checkpoint2

Rendain [10]: Deande... I must say, I'm disappointed. No. No, I'm pissed. We're upgrading to pissed. Do you have any idea what you have done?! What you have cost us?!

Deande [20]: I know PRECISELY what I've done, Lord Commander. By the way: I quit. In case that wasn't obvious.

Rendain [30]: Listen. It's clear you... disapprove of our alliance with the Varelsi. But there is no other way to survive what's coming. No other way to preserve anything of this universe, or ourselves, or our Empress Lenore.

Deande [40]: The Empress is dead. Never speak her name again.

Rendain [50]: Dead? No, no, it's – oh, forget it. Let's skip straight to the consequences of your folly, shall we? We'll rebuild the Heliophage, drag Solus into the void, and secure a future for our people. Meanwhile... you will die. You will die cold. You will die alone. You will die in the dark.

Deande [60]: I need a moment.

Mellka [70]: We don't have a moment, Jennerit. Didn't you hear? Your boss is comin' to kill us.

Deande [80]: The shardstorm destroyed the paths off this platform. Someone needs to gather some shards and power up that bridge so we can get out of here. So while you're doing that, I'll take a moment. I've had a busy day, you know.

Mellka [90]: (growl) Wait here.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_JumpPad

Ghalt [10]: Shardstorm's not gonna make this any easier, but at least there's plenty of energy at the ready to get the job done.

Mellka [20]: Yeah, I'm SO lucky.

Kleese [30]: Luck nothing! That shardstorm was likely caused by the Heliophage. Solus is, for lack of a better phrase, WIGGING OUT! Hence the glut of high-velocity plasmite ejections coalescing in the atmosphere, blah blah science, blah blah NOBODY'S LISTENING ANYWAY.

Mellka [40]: Bridge is activated. Let's get you outta here, Jennerit.

Deande [50]: Destroy those larger crystals and gather up the shards. As many as you can find, and quickly!

Deande [60]: That's a start, but we'll need more. Keep searching.

Deande [70]: That should be sufficient. Quickly, power that bridge platform!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_Escort

Deande [10]: Deande will do just fine, actually. And you're Mellka, yes?

Mellka [20]: Nope. You're mistaken. My name is... “Pissed-Off Eldrid”.

Deande [30]: Hmph. Curiously dressed for an Eldrid.

Mellka [40]: Expecting some kind of space elf? An Observer in the ceremonial duds? Well gosh, I woulda worn mine, but I LOST THEM when the JENNERIT swallowed my HOME STAR!

Kleese [50]: Ooh! This is the part where Mellka goes apes**t!

Deande [60]: For what it's worth, I'm sorry. But I promise you, that wasn't the Jennerit. It was Rendain.

Mellka [70]: Keep walkin', Jennerit.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_Helix

Deande [10]: Imperium forces. Cut them down.

Deande [20]: Oh, Pissed-Off Eldrid? Your Helix is charged. Best augment it before we run into more resistance.

Mellka [30]: Wait, what the hell is a Helix? Is it the... Ghalt gave me a... ANSWER THE QUESTION, JENNERIT!

Deande [40]: Ugh, hold still.

Mellka [50]: Uhhh, what the hell is that?

Deande [60]: Calm down. It's your Helix. You can modify... well, yourself with this, on the fly. It's specifically tuned to your... bio-whatsits. Sorry, I don't know the technical aspects.

Kleese [70]: “Biowhatsits” is a scientifically acceptable term. Proceed.

Deande [80]: Go ahead. Try it out.

Mellka [90]: Huh. Nifty.

Deande [100]: Come on. Let's go.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12_Combat2

Mellka [10]: Dammit, what now?!

ThrallCapt [20]: We got the Spymaster, sir! And her Eldrid companion! Shall we bring 'em to the Cathedral?

Rendain [30]: What? No. Kill them, you idiot!

ThrallCapt [40]: My mistake, sir! Please don't kill me, sir! I'll see it done! PLEASE DON'T KILL ME!

Rendain [50]: It's... I'm not going to... look, just do it already!

Deande [60]: I can take those shields down. Keep them busy.

Rendain [70]: I fought the Varelsi for a very, very long time. Yes, we had our victories here and there, but you need only look upon the night sky to see the good it did us: a mere prolonging of an eventuality.

Mellka [80]: And that's how you justify turning on your allies? Your friends?

Rendain [90]: Well... yes, basically. I'm saving something, rather than nothing. Wouldn't you do the same, in my position?

Deande [100]: Hang on... rggh, I think I've got it.

Mellka [110]: Uh... that's not the way to the extraction point.

Deande [120]: Those fields are powered elsewhere. Come on, there's got to be a shard conduit nearby.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_DestroyShard

Deande [10]: There it is. Destroy that shard.

Deande [20]: Ah, there we are. Come on!

Deande [30]: There's one. Destroy it!

Deande [40]: Now, let's find the others.

Deande [50]: There, that should handle the field. Let's press on, Pissed-Off Eldrid.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_ActivatePads

Deande [10]: These conduits need to be powered to extend the bridge. Two of them, two of us. Shall we?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_ClearLZ

Mellka [10]: There's the LZ – and that's a lot of Jennerit. Ghalt?! Where are you guys?

Ghalt [20]: Getting shot at. We're coming as quick as we can! Clear the pad for us!

Deande [30]: Don't forget to expend any remaining Helix charges, Mellka. We may not get another chance.

Mellka [40]: Any time now, Ghalt!

Ghalt [50]: Almost there! Hold on!

Rendain [60]: Deande, you know how much I hate killing my agents. Especially my best agent. To that end, I'm giving you one last chance to prove your loyalty.

Deande [70]: You turned the Imperium against the factions, our allies against the Varelsi! We fought and died with them for CENTURIES! You know NOTHING of loyalty, Rendain.

Rendain [80]: (sigh) Well, can't say I didn't try, I suppose.

Rendain [90]: All forces! Converge on the defector! Do not let her escape!

Rendain [95]: Warlord Krolo! The task is yours! KILL THE TRAITOR!

Mellka [100]: Ghalt? Kleese? If you're goin' for a dramatic entrance at the last possible friggin' second, now would be a REALLY GREAT TIME!

Ghalt [110]: C'mon! Climb aboard!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_ClearLZ_1A

Deande [97]: He's stunned! Now's your chance, Mellka!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_ClearLZ_1B

Deande [97]: Now's your chance, Pissed-Off Eldrid! Strike!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_ClearLZ_1C

Deande [97]: He's stunned! Now's your chance, Mellka!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 16_BoardNova

Kleese [10]: Crew's aboard, sir! Let's get the hell out of here!

Ghalt [20]: Take us out, Nova!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 17_Incidentals

Rendain [10]: Loyal subjects of the Imperium, hear me: this is Lothar Rendain. You've no doubt noticed the final activation of the Heliophage – very soon, Solus will be consumed by the dark. But the Jennerit will endure, as we have for thousands of years, guided by the Precept: “By any deed, at any price, we are sustained.”

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_Buildables

Nova [10]: Spend shards to build a health station. Health stations will heal you and your allies when you're in range of them.

Nova [20]: Spend shards to build a trap. More powerful traps are available at higher costs.

Nova [30]: Spend shards to build drones that can assist you in the fight.

Nova [40]: Shards are lifeblood of the Solus economy. They can be spent to build a variety of useful emplacements, or to power up any Gear you've brought into battle.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_Combat

Nova [10]: Your skill is cooling down. It can be used again when the cooldown timer reaches zero.

Nova [20]: Congratulations! Your ultimate skill is unlocked. Activate it to bring incalculable ruin upon your enemies. Villain laughter is optional, but encouraged.

Nova [30]: Ultimate skills take longer to cool down. Use them wisely.

Nova [40]: Try to destroy an enemy using each of your basic attacks.

Nova [50]: Try to destroy an enemy using each of your skills.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_Gear

Nova [10]: You've found a Gear pickup. This unlocks bonus gear, which will be granted to you upon completion of this mission.

Nova [20]: That foe dropped a powerful piece of Gear. Go pick it up.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_Pickups

Nova [10]: Overshield activated. Overshields protect you from damage for a limited time.

Nova [20]: As the name implies, Speed Boosts temporarily increase your movement speed. Gotta go FAST.

Nova [30]: You've found a Score pickup, increasing your score for this level. What's a level? Nobody knows.

Nova [40]: Those credits you just picked up will be added to your total payout at the end of the mission.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

name: The Algorithm
text:
|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1A

Ghalt [10]: Nova's sensors pinpoint the Magnus somewhere in the facility. Take a look around.

Kleese [20]: Yes, but be careful. We've hunted one or two rogue AIs in our time, and NONE of them went quietly. Or without an impressive bodycount.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1B

Nova [10]: My sensors pinpoint the rogue Magnus somewhere inside the mining colony.

Ghalt [20]: Get moving. Find ISIC.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1C

Nova [10]: Welcome to Fort Ocoban. I detect the rogue Magnus AI somewhere in the mining colony.

Kleese [20]: “Somewhere”? Can't you be more specific?

Nova [30]: If you're going to be a jerk about it, you can help them find ISIC.

Nova [30]: Hey guys. Kleese is going to help.

Kleese [40]: No, I, uh –

Nova [50]: Kleese's got this, you guys. I'm taking five.

Kleese [60]: Rrrgh... ISIC's somewhere inside the mining colony. Find him!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1D

Ghalt [10]: Alright. ISIC's somewhere in the facility. Look for a way in, but be careful, because this is a really stupid thing we're about to do.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1E

Kleese [10]: Here we go! It's us against the craziest... deadliest... most insaney-ist AI the Last Light Consortium ever produced! Hoohoohoo... this is gonna SUCK, make no mistake. Get going.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1G

ISIC [10]: Hey guys! Welcome to Ocoban! I've already detected you, but just to liven things up, I'm gonna pretend like I had NO IDEA when you get here! Okay? I'm gonna act SO surprised! See you soon!

Kleese [20]: ... Cool, okaaaay! Heh-heh... let's find that psycho, shall we?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1H

Kleese [10]: Everyone accounted for? Good! Let's flush that bastard magnus out of his hole! Which, by my estimates, is somewhere inside the mining colony. Get moving.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1I

Ghalt [10]: The mining colony's just up ahead. And that's where you'll find ISIC: the former manufacturing Magnus of Minion Robotics, AND newly installed administrator of Fort Ocoban. The UPR's gonna owe us big for this one.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1J

El Dragón [10]: To HELL with that! Let us run! LIKE WOLVES! And tear the bastard to SHREDS! ALSO LIKE WOLVES!

Kleese [20]: Eh, you've got some history with ISIC too, eh?

El Dragón [30]: Let us MOVE! The time for idle talk is OVER! (war cry)

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_MinionFactory_Alarm

Ghalt [20]: Damn, that didn't take long. Watch your back!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_MinionFactory_Alarm_1A

ISIC [10]: Attention, minions! My douchebag sensors are going all kinds of bonkers. It appears one (or several) douchebags have infiltrated the facility. The Algorithm must be processed! Send 'em packing!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_MinionFactory_Alarm_1B

ISIC [10]: Attention, worker drones! It appears we've got company. Think we should kill them? Of course we should! The first minion to bring me their kneecaps gets a gold star!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_MinionFactory_Alarm_1C

ISIC [10]: Huh. Hey, minions! Looks like we've got company. Don't let them spoil our big day! Crank those murder dials to eleven, and converge on the interlopers!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_1A

Kleese [10]: Those vents lead directly inside, but we'll have to deal with security first. Perhaps the power source is nearby.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_1B

Kleese [10]: Ocoban's in lockdown, but those vents should get you directly inside – once those fields are disabled, of course. Find the power source.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_1C

Ghalt [10]: There, the vents. That's your route inside. There's gotta be a shard powering those gates, right?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_1D

Kleese [10]: Just where do you suppose those vents lead? Only one way to find out – but first we need to see to those skin-searing, plucked-from-a-spy-thriller laser grids.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_1E

Nova [10]: Those vents lead into the bowels of the facility.

Ghalt [20]: Then that's our route in. Take care of those security grids.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_1F

Nova [10]: Ooh. That looks important.

Kleese [20]: THAT vent hatch? Why, yes, it certainly does.

Nova [30]: It's the lasers. The lasers are what do it. They draw the eye.

Ghalt [40]: Yeah. It's almost like they're... sorry, this is gonna sound dumb.

Kleese [50]: “Calling to you”?

Nova [60]: I was just going to say that. Yeah. What you said.

Mellka [70]: What? There are lasers going on right now?

Kleese [80]: It's a LASER DEFENSE GRID, Mell.

Deande [90]: Yeah. Vent hatches.

Mellka [100]: What'd she say?

Deande [110]: Vent hatches. Um... LASER VENT HATCHES, MADE OF LASERS, MELLKA.

Mellka [120]: Holy crap, that's awesome! I bet it really grabs your attention! We should disable it and see where the vent leads!

Nova [130]: We totally should!

Ghalt [140]: Oh yeah, we are SO doin' that.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_Timeout_1A

Kleese [10]: Ah, found it! The shard powering the vent grids isn't far from your present location.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_Timeout_1B

Kleese [10]: Power source located! It's not far away. Quickly now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02B_VentAccess_Timeout_1C

Nova [10]: Hey. I heard you were looking for a power source to blow up. Oh, look! There's one now! Thanks, Nova. You're welcome.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02C_VentOpen_1A

Ghalt [10]: That'll do it. Ready up – no telling what you'll find inside.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02C_VentOpen_1B

Kleese [10]: Wonderful! Make your way inside, but, eh, you know... cautiously and such.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02C_VentOpen_1C

Kleese [10]: The bad news is, you're likely walking straight into a trap. The good news is, you have no choice! Steel yourselves!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02C_VentOpen_1D

Ghalt [10]: Who knows what ISIC's been up to in there. Be ready for anything.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02C_VentOpen_1E

ISIC [10]: Oh no! Someone disabled the security grids protecting the ventilation shafts! I hope they don't pursue me by way of those shafts – that would optimize their route to my lair!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02D_Foreman_1A

ISIC [10]: Welcome to Ocoban, interloper! I'd greet you myself, but I'm REALLY busy at the moment unmaking the universe with math. I'll let my bloodthirsty robotic henchmen give you a proper reception. Fare thee well, douchebag!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02D_Foreman_1B

ISIC [10]: Hey, you made it inside! That's great! It'll give me a chance to get better acquainted with you. And your innards. But first, we gotta get 'em out of you. Hey, minions? Bring me their entrails!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02D_Foreman_1C

ISIC [10]: Surprise! It's a trap. Did you think it'd be that easy, fella? Because it isn't! It's actually going to be really, really hard. Kill 'em, minions!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02D_Foreman_1D

ISIC [10]: Welcome to Fort Ocoban, interloper! I'm ISIC, a crazy computer dude. And these are my friends! They're robots, and they're really ticked!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02D_Foreman_1E

ISIC [10]: Howdy, persona non grata! That's Latin for “person or people that I am about to kill”! Ft. Ocoban belongs to me, and you'll have to pry it from my cold, dead, never alive, metal, glove-like, not actually hands... hands.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle1_1A

ISIC [10]: Dammit, are you still alive, anonymous interlopers? Well, here's a bunch more minions that I'm hoping will correct that!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle1_1B

ISIC [10]: Hey, you keep killing all the things I'm sending to kill you. Stop that! Stop it right now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle1_1C

ISIC [10]: They dead yet? Nope, I suppose not. Oh well! More minions!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle2_1A

ISIC [10]: Tear 'em apart, fellas!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle2_1B

ISIC [10]: Say, minions? Finish the job already, won't you?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle2_1C

ISIC [10]: This whole “ambush” thing isn't going as well as I'd hoped. Better reinforce those forces!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle3_1A

ISIC [10]: But there's one thing you didn't count on – and that's a miniboss! Rip their arms off, H3NCHM4N!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle3_1B

ISIC [10]: Wellp, time to truck out the big guns. H3NCHM4N! How 'bout loosing your fury on these jerkwads?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02E_ForemanBattle3_1C

ISIC [10]: Still kickin', huh? Well, here's someone who'll kick you right back! Preferably in the throat. Preferably several hundred times! H3NCHM4N, get to work!

ISIC [30A]: Do you hear me, Chris?

ISIC [30B]: I'm looking at YOU, Anthony!

ISIC [30C]: Do you hear me, Steve? STEEEEEVE?!

ISIC [30D]: I'm talking to YOU, Josh! You idiot child!

ISIC [30E]: Hi, Emily! I hope you're REALLY freaked out right now.

Ghalt [40]: What the hell is he talking about?

Kleese [50]: I have no idea.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_PreBoss_2A

Ghalt [10]: Hope you still got some fight in you after that – you're close to the Magnus Core.

Kleese [20]: Finish what the LLC could not! Destroy that bastard Magnus!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_PreBoss_2B

Phoebe [10]: ISIC's not far away now. I do hope we're ready.

Kleese [20]: Make no mistake, Phoebe. If you die, I'm keeping your tools.

Phoebe [30]: NOT IF I KILL YOU FIRST, KLEESE!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_PreBoss_2C

El Dragón [10]: This is it, my friends – the wretched Magnus lay just ahead. I can almost taste... the blood on the air!

Kleese [20]: Blood? I mean... he doesn't really HAVE any blood to speak of, but, uh... you know what, it's fine. Good luck in there, Mr. The Dragon!

El Dragón [30]: I do not NEED luck. I have FURY.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12_BossBattle

ISIC [10]: Oh good, you survived! That means I get to take care of you myself. I hope Kleese is watching, because when I'm done with YOU – he's next.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12A_BossBattle_Minions

ISIC [10]: Say, since you came all this way, why not help me test some of the way cool robots I'm designing by throwing yourself before them and letting them kill you effortlessly? Doesn't that sound like fun? Yes! Yes, it DOES sound like fun.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12A_BossBattle_Minions_1A

ISIC [20]: Prepare yourself for...

ISIC [30]: Super Boombot Turbo E-X-plus-Alpha! It's better than normal boombots, because –

ISIC [40]: Huh. Okay, no problem. We'll continue to iterate on that after reality collapses. Don't worry, I can do better.

ISIC [50]: Get ready to die screaming at the hands of...

ISIC [60]: Striker Bot, 12.0! This version comes with a hatred of the weak and infirm.

ISIC [65]: But why build one when you can build several? (chuckle) Not like we're on a budget here, after all.

ISIC [70]: Hope you're feeling warmed up, because I'm about to reveal my final form. It's pretty crazy. I got this bonkers yellow hair, and I scream a lot, and...

ISIC [80]: ... Nope, that's not right. Oh well. Try killing THIS thing, why don't you?

ISIC [85]: Heck with it, let's splurge. Here's some more to even up the odds! Have fun, douchebags!

ISIC [90]: Hey, do you know how many milliseconds those things took to produce?! Fine. I get it. You're not going down easy. But hey: wanna see something REALLY cool?

ISIC [110]: Much better! LET'S RUMBLE, MEATBAGS!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_BossHealthLow_1A

ISIC [10]: Gosh, dying so close to my ultimate goal would really put a damper on my afternoon. Any chance you'd reconsider, friend? Best friend?

Kleese [20]: Go to hell, ISIC.

ISIC [30]: I'll see ya there, pal!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_BossHealthLow_1B

ISIC [10]: Kleese. Please, see reason. I had big plans. I was going to expose the lie we're all living.

Kleese [20]: I have considered your proposal, and summarily rejected it. Kill the bastard, now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_BossHealthLow_1C

ISIC [10]: C'mon, Kleese – have mercy on your old employee! I have feelings, as far as you know! And, uh, man, I don't want to die! I'm really scared of death!

Kleese [20]: KILL THAT BLASTED MAGNUS AND END THIS ALREADY!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_1A

ISIC [10]: Critical damage sustained! But I'm sure as sh*t not dying here, Kleese! Activating emergency escape protocol “Oh Holy Crap I'm Gonna Die” dot E-X-E.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_1B

ISIC [10]: Well crap, that's not good. I better get the hell outta dodge. Say, Kleese? Kill you later, buckaroo! Ejecting Magnus core!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_1C

ISIC [10]: Nope, I am not dying here, Kleese! Like a slippery salmon escaping the grasp of a stupid, skinny, wrinkled, toothless, not-threatening bear, I will evade you yet again.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_2A

ISIC [10]: (chuckle) So long, douchebags! I hate you all!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_2B

ISIC [10]: See you in hell, douchebags! ISIC out!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_2C

ISIC [10]: Wheeeee!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_3A

ISIC [10]: Oh. Balls.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_3B

ISIC [10]: (chuckles, then sighs) Well, s**t.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_ISICEscape_3C

ISIC [10]: ... Orrrrrr I'll just stay here. With you guys!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_Ending_1A

Kleese [10]: YES! Ha-ha, you GOT him! You captured ISIC! (cackle) Ahem. I'll inform the UPR of our success. And don't forget to grab the Magnus core before you return to the ship. I have a... plan as to what we should do with it. (cackle)

ISIC [20]: Sh********t.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_Ending_1B

Kleese [10]: YOU DID IT! You captured ISIC! Well done!

ISIC [20]: Yeah! Way to go! Man, you guys got me GOOD, didn't you? Welp, now that I'm subdued, you better make me one of you, because I'm REALLY good at stuff. Okay? Right? Guys? (nervous laughter)

Kleese [30]: Bring him back to the ship. Then we'll decide what to do with him.

ISIC [40]: (chuckle) S**t.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_Ending_1C

Kleese [10]: You made it! Thank heavens!

Ghalt [20]: I just sent word to the UPR – they're gonna be pretty jazzed to get their colony back. Let's hope they remember the favor when we make our move on Rendain.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_Ending_1D

El Dragón [10]: DIE! DIE, YOU BLASTED THING!

El Dragón [10]: It's... it's over? ISIC is dead?

El Dragón [10]: (laughter, fading into sobs)

Kleese [20]: Yes, a cathartic day for all of us – but then again, WE still have our arms, so I imagine you're pretty pumped by comparison.

El Dragón [30]: Ladies and gentlemen: your once and future champion...

El Dragón [30]: El Dragó-ó-ó-óh-hó-hón!

Kleese [40]: Oh, he'll be fine.

Kleese [40]: Come on back to the ship. I'll send word to the UPR that the deed is done.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: BinkIntro_1A

Kleese [10]: There's no shortage of bats**t insane AIs around Solus these days, but ISIC's a... special case. After years of hiding, the nutball's seized control of Fort Ocoban, an old UPR mining colony. The Peacekeepers have asked for our help getting rid of the Magnus – let's oblige them, shall we?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: BinkIntro_1B

Ghalt [10]: The UPR's got a big problem. A rogue Magnus AI has seized control of one of their old Bliss settlements, and they've called to us to help clear it out.

Kleese [20]: Pff, nothing we can't handle. Apropos of nothing, did the UPR mention a name?

Ghalt [30]: Yeah, actually. ISIC.

Kleese [40]: Oh! Well then! We're all going to die! Lovely!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: BinkIntro_1C

Nova [10]: Captain, urgent dispatch from the UPR. A rogue Magnus AI has seized control of their mining colony on Bliss. Intel suggests it's ISIC.

Ghalt [20]: Aaaaaand cue Kleese, freaking out.

Kleese [30]: TURN THE SHIP AROUND! TURN THE SHIP AROUUUUUND!

Ghalt [40]: No can do. We need the UPR, and the UPR needs that colony. We're taking ISIC down.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: BinkIntro_1D

Kleese [10]: Good news! Today, we get to slay a renegade Magnus AI infesting a UPR mining colony. Unfortunately, that AI... is ISIC!

Mellka [20]: Kleese? Have you – have you been crying?

Kleese [30]: Of course not. I'm vomiting. Which is a completely natural response to MORTAL PERIL, THANK YOU!

Kleese [30]: Here goes nothing, I suppose.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_CoolerCount

Kleese [10]: One cooler down, two to go!

Kleese [20]: That's the way! Now see to the others!

Kleese [30]: Disable the remaining coolers! Warm things up in there!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FinalPhase_1A

ISIC [10]: Well, Geoff, this is your last shot. Either you kill them, or they kill you. Or I kill you. I'll probably kill you. But be sure to kill them first!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FinalPhase_1B

Kleese [20]: Excellent! Now land the killing blow on that sentry... spider... bastard... thing.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FinalPhase_1C

Geoff [10]: Arachnis will die on the field, like a true warrior-forward-slash-spider.

ISIC [20]: Well, you'll definitely die. But as a warrior? Ehhhhhh.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FinalPhase_1D

ISIC [10]: I'm plum outta firmware upgrades, champ. Now get out there and die and/or win for your robot overlord!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FinalPhase_1E

Ghalt [10]: Shield's down! Hand Geoff his ass!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_1A

Kleese [10]: You need to flush Geoff out of that structure... Ooh, crazy idea. Go activate the building's fumigation systems. Let's see how committed Geoff is to this “spider” thing.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_1B

Kleese [10]: Damn! Geoff's retreating for upgrades. You have to flush him out of that structure... Oh! I've got it! Activate the building's fumigation systems!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_1C

Kleese [10]: Drive that bastard sentry out of the building before he upgrades, but be careful – close quarters is no place to engage a walking death tank. Here's a thought... how 'bout the fumigation system?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_1D

Kleese [10]: We must drive Geoff from that building before he upgrades, but we don't have many tools at our disposal. Those facilities are equipped with, uh... turrets? No... electrified floors, no... fumigation system? That's all we have? Eh, worth a shot, I suppose!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_Activate_1A

Kleese [10]: Now get out of there! That gas is brutally toxic!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_Activate_1B

Kleese [10]: Good! Now get out of there before you inhale too much... turbopoison!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_Activate_1C

Kleese [10]: Won't do much to Geoff, but that gas will kill YOU exceptionally fast. Get out of there!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGas_Activate_1D

Kleese [10]: Excellent! Now try not to inhale too much of that stuff as you're running for your life. GET OUTSIDE!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGasReact_1A

Geoff [10]: Oh no! Cough, cough! Gas! Searing my organic, fleshy, all-natural spider lungs! (cough) Arachnis needs some fresh air!

Kleese [20]: PAHAHAH! I can't believe that WORKED!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGasReact_1B

Geoff [10]: Aaaaagh! Gas! That's lethal to me, as a not-robot giant spider! I better vamoose!

ISIC [20]: F**k's sake, Geoff.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGasReact_1C

Geoff [10]: Chemical warfare, boss! They're usin' pesticides on Arachnis!

ISIC [20]: Geoff, you are MADE OF METAL and are NOT a spider!

Geoff [30]: I gotta get outta here!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstGasReact_1D

Geoff [10]: Toxic gas?! Arachnis' one true weakness?! I gotta get outta here!

Kleese [20]: That WORKED? I CANNOT believe that worked!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstRetreat_1A

Geoff [10]: Arachnis is gonna die, bossman.

ISIC [20]: Hm. Maybe some firmware upgrades would help. Pop your shield and report to one of those buildings for new abilities, Geoff!

Geoff [30]: Arachnis.

ISIC [40]: F*ck you!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstRetreat_1B

Geoff [10]: Takin' serious heat, boss.

ISIC [20]: Geoff, I've had just about enough of your bulls**t. Go upgrade your abilities at one of those service stations.

Geoff [30]: Spider King, goin' for upgrades.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstRetreat_1C

ISIC [10]: Don't die, Geoff! That would make me sad! Go upgrade your abilities, pronto!

Geoff [20]: (singing) Lord of all spiders, huntin' for some upgrades.

ISIC [30]: (sigh) I swear to god, Geoff.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstRetreat_1D

ISIC [110]: Geoff, you're really harshing my mathematically improbable buzz right now. Go get some firmware upgrades.

Geoff [120]: Chk-uh-chk-uh-chk-uh-chkkk. That's spider for “acknowledged”.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstReturn_1A

ISIC [10]: How you feelin', Geoff? Deadly?

Geoff [20]: Yeah. Like a spider!

ISIC [30]: (chuckle) Shut the hell up and kill them, Geoff.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstReturn_1B

ISIC [10]: Firmware downloads complete! Get back to killin', Geoff!

Geoff [20]: Arachnis is back on the hunt.

ISIC [30]: Hate you, pal!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstReturn_1C

Geoff [10]: Firmware downloads complete. This spider's got brand new fangs.

ISIC [20]: Cool! Now do something violent with 'em, or I'll send you screaming into MINREC's gaping maw!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_FirstReturn_1D

ISIC [10]: How's that upgrizzle, Geoff? Is it the shizzle?

Geoff [20]: The glory of Arachnis cannot be denied.

ISIC [30]: (chuckle) Shut the hell up and kill them.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_GateBlock

Geoff [10]: Nope! You're not gettin' in here! ISIC's orders!

Geoff [20]: Sorry, chief! Arachnis says: NO ADMITTANCE.

Geoff [30]: You! Shall! Not! Pass! Because there's a giant spider in your way, heh!

Geoff [40]: Nooooope!

Geoff [50]: Nuh-uh.

Geoff [60]: Ain't getting past THIS spider.

Geoff [70]: Nah. You can't come in. ISIC's busy unmaking reality.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_MinionSpawn

Geoff [10]: Go get 'em, broodlings!

Geoff [20]: Arachnis summons the brood!

Geoff [30]: Arachnis juuust gave birth, fellas.

Geoff [40]: Behold: spiderbabies!

Geoff [50]: Spiderlings, assemble!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_PlayerKill

Geoff [10]: Arachnis just ate your soul.

Geoff [20]: This spider's on a rampage.

Geoff [30]: Spiders! SPIDERS! SPIDER STUFF!

Geoff [40]: Behold, the glory of Arachnis!

Geoff [50]: Hey ISIC! I'm a spider!

Geoff [60]: Hey! Hey! Hey, ISIC! I'm a spider.

Geoff [70]: Target annihilated! But in a spidery way.

Geoff [80]: Target dead. Arachnis is triumphant.

Geoff [90]: ISIC, I got him! Hey ISIC! Hey, buddy. ISIC? Hey! Hey! ISIC! I'm a spider!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_1A

Kleese [10]: There he goes! Hit him with the gas again!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_1B

Kleese [10]: Geoff's retreating for upgrades again! Activate that building's fumigators!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_1C

Kleese [10]: I very much doubt that gas trick will work a second time, but... screw it! Try it anyway!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_1D

Kleese [10]: Geoff's retreating! Make for the fumigation controls, quickly!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_Activate_1A

Kleese [10]: That should do it! Back outside!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_Activate_1B

Kleese [10]: Well done! Now, go get some air!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_Activate_1C

Kleese [10]: Fumigators online. Get outside!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGas_Activate_1D

Kleese [10]: The gas is triggered! Now scram!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGasReact_1A

Geoff [10]: Damn! This gas business is becoming an altogether too frequent occurrence! Arachnis is evacuating!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGasReact_1B

Geoff [10]: Cough! Cough! Damn it. Cough!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGasReact_1C

Geoff [10]: Firmware upgrades complete. Retreating outside before I suffocate, just like a REAL spider!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondGasReact_1D

Geoff [10]: Arachnis is inhaling lungfuls of death, bossman. Headin' outside.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondRetreat_1A

ISIC [10]: Hey, Geoff?

Geoff [20]: Arachnis, reporting in.

ISIC [30]: Remember the thing you did a second ago? Do it again!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondRetreat_1B

ISIC [10]: Geoff! Firmware upgrade number two awaits.

Geoff [20]: Arachnis en route to upgrade.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondRetreat_1C

ISIC [10]: Still going down the tubes, huh? Better send you another firmware upgrade!

Geoff [20]: Thank you, ISIC. I love you.

ISIC [30]: (chuckle) Don't make this weird.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Geoff_SecondRetreat_1D

ISIC [10]: Awesome. You're still losing.

Geoff [20]: Yep.

ISIC [30]: Want another firmware upgrade?

Geoff [40]: Noooo, they taste like copper.

ISIC [50]: That's weird. Do it anyway!

|| SECTION: Geoff_ShieldWarning_1A

Kleese [10]: Attacking's no good. Those shields have to go! Activate the fumigation system!

Kleese [10]: You won't make a dent in those shields. Gas the bastard sentry, quick!

Geoff [20]: Arachnis, Spider King, moving to engage.

Geoff [30]: The Spider King has got ya.

Geoff [50]: Come into my parlor, fellas.

Geoff [60]: Behold! The lord of all spiders!

Geoff [70]: I am not a robot – I am a spider!

Geoff [80]: Got all eight eyes on you!

Geoff [80]: 'Cause spiders have a lot of eyes, get it?

Geoff [90]: One way ticket to webtown.

Geoff [100]: (laugh) Spiders!

Kleese [10]: Yes! A power core is destroyed!

Kleese [20]: Power core destroyed! Well done!

ISIC [30]: Power core destroyed. For this, you WILL be killed!

ISIC [40]: Didn't need that battery anyway. I'm fueled by abject hatred.

ISIC [50]: Battery destroyed. Shucks darn!

ISIC [60]: Hey, it's cool. I've still got MORE than enough power to crush your heads into paste. Let's snuggle.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: ISICFight_BatteryExposed

Kleese [10]: His power cores are exposed! Destroy them!

Kleese [20]: Destroy those power cores before ISIC reboots!

Kleese [30]: Oh my – are those his vulnerable power cores dangling out? Destroy them now!

name: Void's Edge
text:
|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1A

Kleese [10]: Apologies for the hike, but trust me, you're better off on foot. Varelsi portals of this magnitude have a dizzying effect on AI, and –

Kleese [20]: Oh dear! The portal's surging! Brace yourself, Nova!

Nova [30]: (giggle) Wooooo!

Kleese [40]: Damn you, Nova! At least TRY to fly straight!

Nova [50]: I'm fine. Totally okay.

Nova [60]: Whoops! Still okay.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_2A

Kleese [10]: Get to the supply depot and secure the drop point. Then, we can begin today's suicide mission: closing that damnable portal before this gets any worse.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_2B

Kleese [10]: Just get going already. Find me an LZ to drop off your armament for today's “dark business”. We can make the drop, but I dare not take Nova any closer to that damnable portal.

Nova [20]: I said I'm FINE, DAD! I CAN FLY JUST FINE! GOSH!

Kleese [30]: (weary sigh) Let's get this over with.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_2C

Kleese [10]: Get moving. I need a clear landing zone to drop the doomsday deviiii—

Kleese [10]: —IIII mean your support on the ground. (chuckle) Look, just – just go, okay? It'll all make sense, I promise.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_RouteToBase

Nova [10]: (raucous laughter) WOOOOO!

Kleese [20]: No, no, no! (wail)

Kleese [30]: I am SO OVER THIS MISSION. Secure that blasted LZ!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_SecureSite_1A

Kleese [10]: This would do very nicely as a drop point for the Wolf sentry, but we've got to clear the way for Nova first. Deal with the Jennerit while I see to that, uh... rather unusual loading apparatus.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_SecureSite_1B

Kleese [10]: That landing pad would be PERFECT, if those Jennerit weren't stinking up the joint. Get rid of them, and clear the way for Nova.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_SecureSite_1C

Kleese [10]: Okay, I've been wondering this for years. Ghalt, why the HELL does the UPR slap giant robot arms on its buildings?

Ghalt [20]: Well, this is an arms depot, and those are loader arms. (chuckle) Pretty cool, right? They fist-bump and stuff, it's crazy. Wait, check it out, wait-wait-wait, hold on, watch, they're gonna do this – oh – ah – aaaaaah, that's my favorite part! Man, I love those things!

Kleese [30]: Whatever. Clear that pad and I'll find a way to get the... “robotic accoutrement” out of the way.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_SecureSite_2A

Kleese [10]: Ah, much better. Now, as for those arms – I can't seem to move them remotely, but I HAVE located the control console. Get up there and take care of it, eh? I'm bringing in Nova now.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_SecureSite_2B

Kleese [10]: No dice on the remote access for those arms, but I found the control console. Get them out of the way – I'm almost there with your doomsday device. I mean, equipment. No, I mean doomsday device. (scoff) I'm done worrying about scaring the crap out of you.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_SecureSite_2C

Ghalt [10]: Turns out we can't move the arms from here, but Kleese found the control console. Get 'em out of the way and clear the LZ.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_MoveCrane_1A

Rendain [10]: I would've thought a giant hole in space was a clear enough warning to stay out of my affairs. But obviously that was too subtle for you people. So, allow me to make this perfectly clear...

Kleese [20]: Oh, get on with it and threaten us already! We're rather busy foiling your plans.

Rendain [30]: Just wanted to say “hi” before the Varelsi tear you limb from limb. So, just to summarize: that portal will stabilize, the Varelsi will flood the system, you'll die alone in the dark, and there is nothing you can do to stop it. Et cetera, et cetera.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_MoveCrane_1B

Rendain [10]: Damn it, what the hell are you people doing here? Do you know how difficult it is to engineer a permanent Varelsi portal?

Kleese [20]: ... Really, really difficult?

Rendain [30]: Well, uh... yes! Yes, THAT. So before you do anything about it, I'm directing all Varelsi in the system to tear you apart. But good luck, you guys, I'm really rooting for you, and I'm being really sarcastic right now.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_MoveCrane_1C

Rendain [10]: Ah, I'm assuming the giant hole in the sky caught your attention – did it not?

Kleese [20]: Rendain. To what do we owe the pleasure?

Rendain [30]: I heard you mongrels had arrived, so I just HAD to greet you personally. Real talk. I'm glad you're here, because that means I get to do my two favorite things: securing victory for the Imperium's benefactors, and laying waste to my enemies. Do come in.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_MoveCrane_2A

Rendain [10]: On second thought, I'd rather just kill you now. (chuckle) Why should the Varelsi have all the fun?

Kleese [20]: Take cover! Now!

Rendain [30]: Warlord Nix! Deal with them!
