|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1A

Caldarius [50]: My assault frame's power cells were completely depleted in the escape from Tempest. If you want to be of assistance, you can start by restoring power to this facility.

Deande [60]: The main power plant's damaged beyond repair. Kleese, any ideas?

Kleese [70]: According to these schematics from the UPR, an auxiliary power station was built in the caves, but never brought online. That's our best shot!

Kleese [70]: Sorry, did I say “best”? I meant “only”.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1B

Caldarius [50]: I'd slaughter those idiots myself, but my assault frame's power cells must first be recharged – and this facility's power plant lay in ruin.

Ghalt [60]: If that settlement was built like the other Bliss colonies, there should be a backup source somewhere on site... Ah, here we go. Transmitting waypoint data now.

Deande [70]: Stand by, Caldarius. Help is on the way.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1C

Caldarius [50]: My assault frame's fuel cells are depleted. Restore power to this facility, and I'll kill Hylis myself.

Deande [60]: According to these schematics, there's a backup generator some distance from the facility. Transmitting waypoint data.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1D

Caldarius [50]: My frame's fuel cells are utterly depleted. If you wish to help, you can start by restoring power to this facility.

Ambra [60]: Well, I make it a point not to assist in the aiding and abetting of enemies of the Imperium, but I suppose I can make an exception.

Ambra [60]: THIS TIME!

Deande [70]: According to these schematics, there's a backup generator in the caves. Stand by for waypoint data.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1E

Galilea [10]: Ahhh... Bliss. It may be a frozen hellscape, but it's the only home I have left.

Galilea [30]: We make for the caves. Our path lies through there.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_1stBaseRoute_1A

Caldarius [10]: Hylis is one of Rendain's most... persistent agents. He will not give up until I'm returned to Tempest. I'd sooner DIE than give him the satisfaction.

Jailer Hylis [20]: Aw, c'mon, Cal! We had some good times, right?

Caldarius [30]: Every day I spent in your care was endless torment.

Jailer Hylis [40]: Aw, thanks! I'm pretty proud of my work.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_1stBaseRoute_1B

Caldarius [10]: Forgive my hostility. I'm not used to others fighting my battles for me. I was a fool to think my armor would survive the descent unscathed.

Deande [20]: To hell with the armor, I'm shocked you survived.

Caldarius [30]: I've been through worse.

Jailer Hylis [40]: He sure has! And there's a whole lot more of that waiting for him back on Tempest.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_1stBaseRoute_1C

Jailer Hylis [10]: I've been doing this job for centuries, and never lost a single prisoner. Not about to start today. Just give up already, Caldy. We can skip all this busy work and get straight to the fun stuff back on Tempest.

Deande [20]: “Fun stuff”?

Caldarius [30]: (heavy sigh) He means torture.

Jailer Hylis [40]: Ding ding ding ding! I DO mean torture! And there's plenty of torture to go around, if the rest of you want to come – or you can turn around, and leave me to my quarry.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_1stBaseRoute_1D

Jailer Hylis [10]: There's nowhere left to run, Caldarius! Come on out and face me!

Caldarius [20]: Give me a moment to think it over.

Caldarius [20]: I've elected to pass on your offer.

Jailer Hylis [30]: Gonna make me work for it, huh? Good! On my way here I was worried I'd be bored s**tless on this mission, but as you know, I love a good chase. Give it your best shot, Caldy! It'll make putting you back in irons SO much more satisfying.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_1stBaseRoute_1E

Phoebe [10]: I've heard a great deal about Caldarius – “the Kemessian”, as he's known. And that assault frame of his – J-HTX Mark VI is the model, I believe – is just... (dreamy sigh) Well, there are no words. (titillated shiver) But then, I have something of a THING for flying death robots.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_Countdown

Deande [10]: If these schematics are correct, there are several facilities surrounding the central core that could be very useful in shoring up a defense. I recommend securing them as soon as possible.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_1stBaseCapture_1A

Deande [10]: Ah – there's the backup generator, and still in one piece, thankfully. Fire it up, and we'll keep an eye on the power levels from Nova.

Kleese [20]: Yes, but a word of caution: there must be a REASON that this substation was never activated.

Kleese [20]: Oh, but screw it, caution to the wind and that! Activate the generator!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_1stBaseCapture_1B

Deande [10]: There's the backup generator – and still functional, by the looks of it.

Ghalt [20]: According to base records, that substation was decommissioned after the UPR discovered an “unforeseen security risk”. Go ahead and activate it, but be ready for anything.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_1stBaseCapture_1C

Deande [10]: That's the generator! Once we get it started, that should provide MORE than enough power to recharge Caldarius' assault frame.

Ghalt [20]: The UPR's not the sort to turn their back on a resource without a damn good reason. Something tells me we're about to learn why.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_1stBaseCapture_1D

Galilea [10]: If it's power Caldarius needs, this generator should suffice.

Deande [20]: Fire it up, but be careful – no telling what sort of attention that machine will draw once it's activated.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_1A

Deande [10]: We're detecting loads of activity down there! Prepare for battle! Defend the generator until it's fully initialized!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_1B

Deande [10]: What the HELL is going on down there?

Kleese [20]: The generator woke up the locals, and surprise, surprise, the locals are both hostile and incredibly pissed.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_1C

Deande [10]: Protect the generator! It needs time to initialize!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_1D

Phoebe [10]: Oh crap, the generator woke something up! DAMN YOU, SCIENCE!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_2A

Deande [10]: You alright down there? We're detecting more of them coming your way – prepare yourselves!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_2B

Kleese [10]: The generator's not fully initialized yet, and there's bound to be more of those THINGS lurking around. Hold fast! We're not through yet.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_2C

Deande [10]: Phew. Is that all of them?

Ghalt [20]: Look – I know you're new to this crew, but c'mon. Is that ever ALL of them?

Deande [30]: It... it MIGHT be.

Nova [40]: It isn't. More hostiles inbound.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_1stBaseDefend_2D

Deande [10]: Ugh, more of them coming your way! Don't give up, you're almost there!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05_1stBaseDefendComplete_1A

Deande [10]: Excellent. The generator's functioning beautifully. What's next?

Kleese [20]: Now it's just a matter of redirecting power to our... “new friend”. Facility Control is your next destination.

Deande [30]: Get moving. If Caldarius is located before he's ready for combat, he won't stand a chance.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_2ndBaseRoute_1A

Jailer Hylis [10]: Rendain doesn't take kindly to fugitives. Or the treasonous. Or anybody, really. He's basically not a kind guy. But I'm not here for you fools. I'm here for Caldarius.

Deande [20]: So are we. And since we've arrived first, we have, uh... what are they called, Kleese?

Kleese [30]: Oh! “First dibs.”

Deande [40]: YES! First dibs! WE have first dibs, so I'm afraid you'll have to deal with US FIRST, you DIB! Pahaha!

Jailer Hylis [50]: Well, heck, if you insist.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_2ndBaseRoute_1B

Jailer Hylis [10]: Who the hell are you people, anyway? Who's this chump to you? Do you know what he's guilty of? Why we threw him in prison all those years ago?

Deande [20]: As I understand it, Rendain imprisoned him because he became a celebrated hero of the people.

Jailer Hylis [30]: That's right! And for that most heinous of crimes, he'll suffer to his last breath.

Caldarius [40]: I can't wait to kill that man.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_2ndBaseRoute_1C

Jailer Hylis [10]: Hey wait a minute, I recognize that voice. You're Deande, aren't you? Rendain's right hand?

Deande [20]: Not anymore.

Jailer Hylis [30]: Wow! Big fan! Just a big fan of your work, that's all. Man, I get to kill the high spymaster! Back at the prison, we mainly just deal with turncoats and heretics but this is... this is something special!

Jailer Hylis [30]: Guys! Guys, we get to kill Deande! Yeah! The spymaster herself!

Deande [40]: Hm. Apparently I'm not as popular as I once believed.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_2ndBaseRoute_1D

Ghalt [10]: According to YOUR files, this guy's been killin' Jennerit elite since he broke out of prison. What if you're on his hit list?

Deande [20]: I'm sure I am. But I WAS the one who freed him, and that means all is forgiven. Forever. Surely... right?

Ghalt [30]: All that time, though? In solitary? If it was me, I'd totally kill you.

Deande [40]: That's very heartening, Captain.

Orendi [50]: YAYYY! EVERYONE KILL DEANDE! YAYYYYYY!

Nova [50]: I would also kill you.

Phoebe [50]: How were his brains not mush after a hundred years, Deande? Hmm? HMMMMM?! What. About. His brains?

Deande [60]: ALRIGHT! I got it! We're JERKS!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_2ndBaseArrive_1A

Deande [10]: Damn! The Imperium beat us here. Get rid of them and secure the substation!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_2ndBaseArrive_1B

Deande [10]: There's the facility control station. Cut a path through those Jennerit.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_2ndBaseArrive_1C

Deande [10]: There's the facility control substation, just behind that wall of hostiles. Take them out!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_2ndBaseArrive_1D

Deande [10]: There's the facility control substation. Once you clear out those hostiles, you'll have unfettered access to the power grid.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_2ndBaseCapture_1A

Deande [10]: Uplink established. Rerouting power to the engineering core now...

Deande [20]: Nothing... ugh, damn. What now?

CaptainsAI [30]: Power redirection failed. System reboot required. Please stand by.

Deande [40]: As if we had a choice. Prepare yourselves! Hylis' forces are inbound to your location!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_2ndBaseCapture_1B

CaptainsAI [10]: Power redirection failed. System reboot required. Please stand by.

Jailer Hylis [20]: Power redirection, huh? Well, there's only one place you jerks could be hiding out.

Jailer Hylis [30]: All forces! Caldy's idiot friends have reached the facility control station! BURN IT TO THE GROUND!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_2ndBaseCapture_1C

CaptainsAI [10]: Power redirection failed. System reboot required. Please stand by.

Deande [20]: Reboot? Wait! Please don't reboot, PLEASE don't reboot...

CaptainsAI [30]: You can't tell me what to do. Initializing system reboot.

Deande [40]: Rrgh – better dig in! Hylis' forces are on their way!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_2ndBaseCapture_1D

CaptainsAI [10]: Power redirection failed. System reboot required. Please stand by.

Galilea [20]: Wretched machine! Now's not the TIME for that!

CaptainsAI [30]: Namecalling won't make this any quicker. Initializing system reboot.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_2ndBaseCapture_1E

CaptainsAI [10]: Power redirection failed. System reboot required. Please stand by.

Jailer Hylis [20]: Ah... so that's your play, huh? Well, you're about to learn why you shouldn't stick your neck out for political prisoners.

Jailer Hylis [30]: Gamma squad, get over to facility control and level that station!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_2ndBaseDefend_1A

Jailer Hylis [10]: What do you mean, “still standing”?! Epsilon squad, get over there and level that substation, immediately!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_2ndBaseDefend_1B

Deande [10]: It's not over yet! We're seeing heavy reinforcements deploying from the capital ship!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_2ndBaseDefend_1C

Jailer Hylis [10]: Gamma squad, report! Gamma squad!

Jailer Hylis [10]: Wait – they took out ALL OF 'EM?!

Deande [20]: I'm sorry, they were in our way.

Jailer Hylis [30]: Epsilon squad! You're up next! Get your asses over there, now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_2ndBaseDefendComplete_1A

Deande [10]: I'm reading steady power levels from the engineering core. Caldarius, what's your status?

Caldarius [20]: Charging now. Unfortunately, Hylis has already found me.

Jailer Hylis [30]: That's right! You're screwed, Caldy! And when I throw you back in that box of yours, you're NEVER comin' out!

Caldarius [40]: You may want to hurry.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_2ndBaseDefendComplete_1B

Deande [10]: Power rerouted. Caldarius, you should be all set.

Jailer Hylis [20]: Ooh, an energy spike. Could that be our man? I better send every Thrall at my disposal to investigate!

Deande [30]: Hurry to the engineering core! Caldarius needs our support!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_2ndBaseDefendComplete_1C

Caldarius [10]: Ah, the lights are on. My frame is recharging now. However begrudgingly, I thank you, Deande.

Jailer Hylis [20]: Don't thank her just yet, Caldy! Thanks to that energy signature, I now know exactly where you are. See you soon, friend!

Deande [30]: Get to the engineering core! Caldarius is still defenseless!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_3rdBaseRoute_1A

Caldarius [10]: I'm... impressed. Your friends are stronger than I expected, Deande.

Deande [20]: They're no slouches, that's for sure.

Caldarius [30]: I hope not. Hylis may be an idiot, but he's persistent.

Jailer Hylis [40]: And handsome! You forgot incredibly handsome, Caldy.

Caldarius [50]: Oh. Yeah, he's pretty handsome.

Jailer Hylis [60]: Not the response I was expecting, but... thanks! You're a SWEETHEART!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_3rdBaseRoute_1B

Ghalt [10]: Bad news, guys. Our backup air support's not comin'. And Nova doesn't stand a chance against a Jennerit capital ship.

Caldarius [20]: Your ship won't be needed. I can handle the jailer's vessel just as soon as my fuel cells are recharged.

Ghalt [30]: One guy against that? Are you insane?

Caldarius [40]: Just a little bit.

Deande [50]: Trust me, Captain, if he says he can handle it, he can handle it. Caldarius is not one for exaggeration.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_3rdBaseRoute_1C

Caldarius [10]: Your friends fight well, Deande. But do you REALLY think you stand a chance against the FULL might of the Imperium?

Kleese [20]: Oh, of course not!

Deande [30]: Kleese!

Kleese [40]: As a matter of fact, our odds of success are BEYOND dismal.

Mellka [50]: Kleese. Shut. Up!

Kleese [60]: But it sure beats sitting on our hands while we wait to die. If nothing else, we're never bored. And a crap chance is better than no chance, wouldn't you agree?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_3rdBaseRoute_1D

Jailer Hylis [10]: It's gonna be a gorgeous moment when I haul your ass back to Tempest. I'm talking parades, medals, talk show appearances, all of that. But best of all? A seat on Rendain's lifeboat once Solus bites the dust. C'mon, admit it. You're jealous.

Caldarius [20]: I'd rather die free than survive as a sniveling coward.

Jailer Hylis [30]: And die you shall, Caldarius. Just as soon as THIS sniveling coward is through breaking your mind, your body, and your spirit.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_3rdBaseRoute_1E

Jailer Hylis [10]: Boy, oh boy, Caldy. You think prison sucked before? Just wait until round two. When I'm done with you, the century you spent rotting in a cell will feel like a VACATION. An all-inclusive spa getaway. You'll wish I launched you into the heart of a dying star. You'll beg for death, and I'll be like, “Nah, more torture.” Hahahaha! Ah, if only everyone found their work as fulfilling as I do.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12_BridgeCombatMinions

Deande [10]: Got some good news for once: Nova located a gaggle of inactive minion units while she was scouring the settlement's network. We're sending them your way now – make that extra firepower count!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_3rdBaseArrive_1A

Jailer Hylis [10]: The hell is taking so long?! BRING ME CALDARIUS!

Deande [20]: Dammit, they're already here! Cut through Hylis' forces and reach Caldarius!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_3rdBaseArrive_1B

Caldarius [10]: Imperium forces have reached the engineering core. I imagine I'll be killed momentarily.

Deande [20]: We're not giving up so easily. Hold on, Caldarius! We're almost there!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_3rdBaseArrive_1C

Deande [10]: The bay is surrounded! Caldarius, you still alive in there?

Caldarius [20]: For the moment, yes.

Deande [30]: Hold tight! Backup's on the way!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_3rdBaseDefend

Jailer Hylis [70]: All units! Attack the engineering core! Bring me Caldarius and make sure he's alive enough to kill!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_3rdBaseDefend_1A

Deande [10]: Caldarius, how much longer before your assault frame is recharged?

Caldarius [20]: Mere minutes. Which we may not have.

Deande [30]: We'll buy you as much time as we can!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_3rdBaseDefend_1B

Jailer Hylis [10]: Rrrrgh, you IDIOTS! I am NOT going back to Rendain empty handed!

Caldarius [20]: He'd most certainly kill you for your failure.

Jailer Hylis [30]: Yeah, I'm aware of that, THANKS!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_3rdBaseDefend_1C

Caldarius [10]: Jailer Hylis is on his way, no doubt.

Phoebe [20]: Oh, don't worry – we'll handle it.

Caldarius [30]: Why do you do this? Why do you fight for me?

Phoebe [40]: Because we're pursuing the same goal! And because giant flying death mecha are, you know... my FAVORITE thing in the universe.

Phoebe [40]: Sooo, whatcha doin' after we save your life, fella?

Caldarius [50]: Resuming my fiery march of vengeance against Lothar Rendain. The tyrant. The usurper. He will die by my blade!

Phoebe [60]: Oh. Okay.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_AttackFromAbove_1A

Deande [10]: Look up! They're coming in from above!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_AttackFromAbove_1B

Deande [10]: The windows, above! They're coming in from the windows!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_AttackFromAbove_1C

Deande [10]: We have heavy reinforcements coming in from above the station!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 16_3rdBaseDefendComplete

Caldarius [10]: Assault frame charge complete, in three... two... one!

Caldarius [20]: That's better. Now then... please allow me to assist you.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 17_BossFight_1A

Jailer Hylis [10]: I guess if you want something killed right, you gotta kill it yourself. Get ready, Caldarius! I'M COMING FOR YOUR F*CKIN' HEAD!

Caldarius [20]: Hmph. What happened to taking me alive?

Jailer Hylis [30]: SCREW THAT! YOU'RE GOIN' BACK TO TEMPEST IN A SHOEBOX!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 18_Outro_1A

Caldarius [10]: I thank you for the assistance, Deande. You and your friends. Now let me take care of the rest.

Caldarius [20]: I believe you said something about slaying Lothar Rendain. Please, allow me to help.

Deande [30]: You'll hear no argument from me. Come back to the ship, everyone – we've got a lot more work to do.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_1stBaseHealth25_1A

Deande [10]: We're about to lose the generator! FIGHT, damn you!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_1stBaseHealth25_1B

Kleese [10]: If we lose that generator, we lose our only shot at getting Caldarius out alive! Eyes open! Fists and butts clenched! FIGHT!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_1stBaseHealth25_1C

Deande [10]: The generator's almost done for! Don't let them near it!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_1stBaseHealth75_1A

Deande [10]: Keep those wretched things off of the generator!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_1stBaseHealth75_1B

Deande [10]: The generator's taking damage! Kill those hostiles, quickly!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_1stBaseHealth75_1C

Kleese [10]: Auxiliary generator under fire! Someone should, y'know, probably DO something about that.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_2ndBaseHealth25_1A

Deande [10]: The station can't take much more of that! Kill those Jennerit before they do ANY more damage!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_2ndBaseHealth25_1B

Deande [10]: We're about to lose the station! Defend it at all costs!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_2ndBaseHealth25_1C

Deande [10]: Critical damage sustained! Protect the station!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_2ndBaseHealth75_1A

Deande [10]: Defend the station! If we lose it, we lose everything!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_2ndBaseHealth75_1B

Deande [10]: The station's taking a beating! Drive Hylis' forces back!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_2ndBaseHealth75_1C

Deande [10]: If the station falls, Caldarius is doomed. Keep the Jennerit at bay!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_3rdBaseHealth25_1A

Caldarius [10]: Rrgh... dammit! It can't end here!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_3rdBaseHealth25_1B

Caldarius [10]: This can't be where it ends. Not here!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_3rdBaseHealth25_1C

Caldarius [10]: Kill the bastards before they raze this facility to the ground!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_3rdBaseHealth75_1A

Deande [10]: Heavy damage sustained! Defend the engineering core!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_3rdBaseHealth75_1B

Deande [10]: Caldarius needs more time! Protect the core until his frame is charged!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_3rdBaseHealth75_1C

Caldarius [10]: Damn it! Keep the Jennerit away from the core!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight

Jailer Hylis [10]: I'm comin' for you, Cal!

Jailer Hylis [20]: OUTTA MY WAY! CALDARIUS IS MINE!

Jailer Hylis [30]: DAMN IT, I WANT MY QUARRY!

Jailer Hylis [40]: Rrrrgh... CALDARIUUUUUUS!

Jailer Hylis [50]: I'll take you home in a box smaller than the one I threw you in, Cal!

Jailer Hylis [60]: I'm gonna CAPTURE-SLASH-KILL THAT FRICKIN' RUSTBUCKET!

Jailer Hylis [70]: BRING ME CALDARIUS!

Jailer Hylis [80]: Cut 'em down! I WANT THAT FRIGGIN' MECH!

Jailer Hylis [90]: YOU CAN'T RUN FROM ME, CALDARIUS!

Jailer Hylis [100]: CALDARIUUUUUUUUUUUUUUS!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_Reinforcements_Incoming

Kleese [10]: Jennerit dropships, inbound!

Kleese [20]: More reinforcements en route to your location!

Kleese [30]: More Jennerit cronies are arriving! Ready yourselves!

Kleese [40]: Dropships coming our way! Prepare for reinforcements!

name: The Archive
text:
|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1A

Ghalt [10]: Mellka's at the Grove, working on dumping all the Codex data. But we need a way to transport it back to Nova and get it off Ekkunar.

Mellka [20]: Oh s**t, is that you guys? Crap, it's about time you showed up! You need a courier for the data? Dig up some shards and power up the Chronicle sentry, and then get the HELL over here – Rendain's going for our throats!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1B

Ghalt [10]: Mellka, what's your status?

Mellka [20]: Well, s**t's on fire, so not too great, cap! We're gonna need some help trucking all this data out of here. You gotta find Chronicle – he's the grove's librarian and, conveniently, a heavily armed sentry. Activate him and get the hell over here, NOW!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1C

Mellka [10]: Bout f**kin' TIME you guys showed up! I'm almost ready with the Codex data here at the Grove, but we'll need some help getting it back to Nova. There's a sentry near your location that should be able to help. Find some shards, and get him moving!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1D

Nova [10]: Mellka is dumping all Codex archival data at the Grove of the Arcanum. Please activate the Arcanum's assistant sentry and join her at the library. You'll know it when you see it. It's a giant tree, because, you know, the Eldrid.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_2A

Mellka [10]: That should be enough. Go power up Chronicle!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_2B

Kleese [10]: That should be sufficient. Go activate the Eldrid sentry!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_SentryActivate_1A

S1.Chroncile [10]: Startup diagnostics complete! Welcome, friends. I'm Chronicle, and I'll be guiding you on your tour of the Grove of the Arcanum.

S1.Chroncile [10]: Which is presently on fire, that's weird!

Mellka [20]: Chronicle! It's Mellka! Ekkunar's under siege, and we gotta get the Codex offworld. We need your help!

S1.Chroncile [30]: Huh. That's not my USUAL job, but then again, the Grove isn't usually ON fire, so... lead the way, fellas!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_SentryActivate_1B

S1.Chroncile [10]: Hey there, stranger! I'm Chronicle, your guide to the nigh-infinite world of Eldrid knowledge. Welcome to the Grove of the Arcanum!

S1.Chroncile [10]: Apologies, it is presently engulfed in flames.

Mellka [20]: Chronicle, it's Mellka! I need some help getting at the Grove!

S1.Chroncile [30]: Heyyyy, little lady! Welcome back to the Grove of the Arcanum. First things first, you have EIGHT books overdue! You've got a week before I send the guards. Item number two: HOLY S**T, THE GROVE IS ON FIRE!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_SentryActivate_1C

S1.Chroncile [10]: Howdy! I'm Chronicle, your guide to the world of Eldrid Knowledge. Welcome to the Grove of the Arcanum, home of the remnants of the Codex, which comprises the whole of ooooh my god! Everything is on FIRE!

Mellka [20]: Yeah! We gotta get the Codex outta here!

S1.Chroncile [30]: Boy howdy, I'll say we do! Lead the way, guys!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_OpenGate_1A

S1.Chroncile [10]: Weird. This door isn't normally locked! Let me get in touch with security...

Mellka [20]: What? Dammit, Chronicle – guys, just find the shards powering the gate and blow 'em up like usual!

S1.Chroncile [30]: Sure! Or I could just do this.

S1.Chroncile [40]: Alright! Tour resumes! Now, on your left is a thing on fire. On your right is a thing that is ALSO on fire.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_OpenGate_1B

S1.Chroncile [10]: Locked? It's not supposed to be locked. Outta my way, door! The grove's on fire!

S1.Chroncile [20]: Librarian one, door zilch. Hah! Suck it, obstructions!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ToFirstPoint_1A

Kleese [10]: Why not transfer the data wirelessly?

Ghalt [20]: There's just too much of it to ensure a stable transmission. Here, take a look for yourself...

Ghalt [30]: (struggling) This is the manifest the Observatory sent along...

Kleese [40]: Aaaagh! Those were my bones, you nitwit! I need those, probably!

Ghalt [50]: The Codex is everything they've learned about every species, civilization, and star they've encountered – so, you know, a LOT of data.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ToFirstPoint_1B

Kleese [10]: So instead of escorting civilians to safety, we're looking after data? I can't be the only one who feels a bit strange about all this.

Ghalt [20]: That data represents TENS of thousands of years of effort, and it's just a fraction of what they had before the Varelsi took their homew...

Ghalt [20]: Wait. You're worried about the civilians? That's... very un-Kleese of you.

Kleese [30]: Yes, yes, as it turns out, I have feelings. And I'll thank you never to mention them again.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ToFirstPoint_1C

Deande [10]: What value is data if none survive to utilize it? Captain, we should be assisting the Peacekeepers with the evacuation, not tending to a burning library.

Thorn [20]: Very touching. Tell me, Deande – where was your concern during the darkening of Codex? The slaughter of her people? Or the many purgings of Ekkunar prior to this one? (scoff) Spare me your hollow sentiment.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ToFirstPoint_1D

Deande [10]: I do hope the civilians are okay.

Ghalt [20]: They've survived plenty of attacks before, and they're pretty good at getting out of tight spots.

Kleese [30]: Not that it's done them much good. The Eldrid used to span entire galaxies... now, there's barely any of them left.

Mellka [40]: Yeah, so, what say we all stop talking about how f*cked the Eldrid are, and instead, maybe take a stab at unf*cking the Eldrid. Sound good? Good.

Mellka [40]: God, you guys yap a lot.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05_FirstPoint_Intro

Mellka [40]: Get those minions back to Chronicle before this place burns to the ground. I'm counting on you!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05_FirstPoint_Intro_1A

Mellka [10]: Hey-hey, you made it. Alright, I'm dumping all the data into some... uh... data minion thingies.

S1.Chroncile [20]: Have you scanned your library card, Ms. Mellka?

Mellka [30]: Yes, Chronicle, that's adorable, but SHUT UP. Okay, here goes nothin'...

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05_FirstPoint_Intro_1B

Kleese [10]: Minion replication initialized. I've instated some data redundancy protocols to ensure that not all minions must be saved to reconstruct the Codex – but there is a limit to how much we can lose.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05A_FirstPointRendain

Nova [40]: Multiple Jennerit detachments are diverting to the Grove.

Mellka [40]: Aw, crap – we got lots of Imperium forces coming this way!

Ghalt [40]: Dammit – Jennerit reinforcements inbound!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05A_FirstPointRendain_1A

Rendain [10]: Ah, here are some familiar faces. We have to stop running into each other like this. (chuckle) People are going to talk. I was so busy wiping the Eldrid scourge from the face of Ekkunar that I almost didn't notice you there. Why aren't you fighting with your compatriots on the front lines? What has your attention here?

Mellka [20]: F****ck YOU! F*ck you, f*ck you, f*ck you, F*CK YOU, YOU VAMPIRE F*CK!

Kleese [20]: Uhhhh... Oh! Camping trip! Yes. A very, very poorly timed camping trip.

Rendain [30]: I WAS wondering where the Codex was hidden. I mean, I figured it'd be tucked away in a tree somewhere because, you know, the Eldrid, but there are a great many trees on this blasted planet, and... (sigh) Look, the point is, I know where Codex is now. So I'm coming to destroy it. Thanks for the heads up.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05A_FirstPointRendain_1B

Rendain [10]: Ah, Captain Ghalt and friends. What a surprise to see you here! Here I was, so tied up with ridding this planet of the Eldrid scourge once and for all, I almost didn't notice you there, doing... whatever it is you're doing. And once we detected the Nova, one of my esteemed colleagues had a lovely idea. (chuckle) Go on, Branford, tell them your idea. It's good, listen.

Branford [20]: Uh... “kill two birds with one stone”, milord?

Rendain [30]: Yes! A delightful expression, is it not? I had never heard it before. I particularly enjoy the part where it likens you to an animal I'm about to kill with a rock. (chuckle) Consider us even, Captain. And give Deande my best, won't you?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05A_FirstPointRendain_1C

Rendain [10]: Ah. I figured I'd see the crew of the Nova sooner or later. Hm... this far from the battle? You're not saving civilians. You're saving something more... precious. Codex, perhaps?

Mellka [20]: Don't you have a genocidal rampage to tend to, you homicidal vampire f*ck?! JEEZ, I REALLY hate you!

Rendain [30]: That's really convenient, because I was looking ALL OVER for that overblown encyclopedia, and now I know where it is, so thank you. Much appreciated. And what's about to happen... is your fault.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_FirstPoint_End_1A

Rendain [10]: Attention, everyone: I'm about to break the Eldrid's spirit in half.

Rendain [20]: Bombers! Target that tree! Bring it down NOW!

Ghalt [30]: Jennerit strike cruisers are coming your way! Everyone get clear!

Mellka [40]: I just need a second!

Ghalt [50]: NOW, MELLKA!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_ToSentry_1A

Ghalt [10]: Mell, you alright?

Ghalt [10]: MELLKA!

Mellka [20]: (coughing) Good news, I'm alive! Better news, we got all the data! Chronicle, let's get you outta here!

S1.Chroncile [30]: Sooooo... I guess the tour's over, huh? C'mon, let's hustle.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_ToSentry_2A

Ghalt [10]: Mellka? You alright?! Report!

Mellka [20]: (coughing) Yeah! I mean – y'know, I almost died, and it was epic as hell, but I'm good! (cough) And, I think that's the last of the Codex data. So c'mon – let's get Chronicle the hell outta here!

S1.Chroncile [30]: So, looks like that went REAL well, you guys. Saw it all from here, fantastic. Let's mosey, shall we?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_ToSentry_3A

Ghalt [10]: Mellka! You okay? Report!

Mellka [20]: (coughing) Hell yes I am! Last thing I saw before everything went nuts**t was the confirmation: Codex is secure. Let's get the big guy the hell off this planet, now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_SecondPoint_Stream1_1A

Ghalt [10]: Chronicle's in position, Mell!

Mellka [20]: Alright, we got two more Codex terminals left to evacuate. We gotta move fast. Follow me!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_SecondPoint_Arrival_1A

Mellka [10]: Alright, bringing the replicators online now...

Mellka [20]: There they go! Get them safely to Chronicle!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_SecondPoint_Stream2_1A

Deande [10]: Mellka, we've got more Imperium forces coming your way. We're running out of time!

Mellka [20]: Rrrrgh, screw it – c'mon! We gotta activate the last replicator!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_SecondPoint_Battle_1A

Mellka [10]: Kleese, how we doin'?

Kleese [20]: The data set is nearly complete. We're at 90% of parity.

Ghalt [30]: Good. As soon as the set's in hand, we gotta get that sentry safely back to Nova. You got me?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_SecondPoint_Battle_1B

Mellka [10]: Where we at, Kleese?

Kleese [20]: 90% of the Codex is in hand!

Mellka [30]: Alright, as soon as we're done, we're getting Chronicle back to the ship. Everybody on board with this plan?

S1.Chroncile [40]: That's gonna be a problem for me. I live here. I don't want to leave my home.

Mellka [50]: Everyone whose opinion I GIVE a sh*t about on board with this plan?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_SecondPoint_Battle_1C

Mellka [10]: Alright, I think we're almost through here. As soon as we're done, we gotta get Chronicle back aboard the ship and the hell off of Ekkunar. Sound good?

S1.Chroncile [20]: Um, we're doing WHAT?!

Mellka [30]: Uh – yeah, we're kidnapping you. Sorry. Forgot to say.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12_DumpComplete_1A

S1.Chroncile [10]: Data evacuation complete. I'm just chock full of knowledge right now, fellas.

Mellka [20]: We've gotten all that we can get out of the Grove – we're good, Ghalt!

Ghalt [30]: That's it! We're done! Everyone get back to the ship, on the double!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12_DumpComplete_1B

Kleese [10]: Codex download complete!

Mellka [20]: Alright, we're done! Now let's get Chronicle back to Nova and get out of here!

S1.Chroncile [30]: So, my cousin Geoff gets to be a spider, while I get to be kidnapped and jobless. Great. Love that. Fantastic.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_ToNova_1A

Rendain [10]: I'm sorry, Captain, but I can't let you leave. I believe I mentioned something about owing you one, didn't I?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_RoutetoBoss_1A

Nova [10]: Sensors are detecting spacetime deformation signatures corresponding to no known Varelsi. There's something waiting to kill you, and I have no idea what it is. Good luck!

Kleese [20]: Well, that's, uh... something to look forward to, eh?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_RoutetoBoss_1B

Rendain [10]: Our benefactors are very interested in the data you're trying to cart offworld, so they've arranged a very special visit from a particularly nightmarish Varelsi. Die with your eyes OPEN, won't you? It'll make laughing over your corpse so much more satisfying.

Kleese [20]: It's never as simple as “Oh, we'll just be going now”, is it?! Be ready for anything.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_FinalBoss_1A

Rendain [10]: Enough of this. Bagranth! Destroy that sentry!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_FinalBoss_2A

Mellka [10]: Protect Chronicle – if we lose him, we lose everything!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_FinalBoss_3A

Ghalt [10]: That'll do! Now get Chronicle back to Nova – we're getting out of here!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14A_BossTutorial_1A

Nova [10]: The route to the ship is blocked. Does our SCIENCE OFFICER have any bright ideas?

Kleese [20]: I've... well, I've never seen it before. And it's guarded by an incredibly powerful shield. Your weapons won't do much!

S1.Chroncile [30]: Well heck, we got some crazy powerful turrets set up for just such an occurrence. Let's try firing those up!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14A_BossTutorial_1B

Nova [10]: Shield analysis complete. Your weapons are probably useless. So I guess we're all screwed now.

S1.Chroncile [20]: The Observatory sent us some pretty wild new turrets about a week ago – could try those. Haven't tested 'em yet, because I shun violence in the library. But for you fellas, Chronicle makes an exception.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14A_BossTutorial_1C

Kleese [10]: Big boy up ahead's very well defended. You'll need a bit more punch to get through his shields. Ehh, maybe if, hmm... ah! Activate those turrets!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14A_BossTutorial_1D

Nova [10]: We're in range of that new-and-improved Varelsi. Team heart rate at elevated levels. Any suggestions, Kleese?

Kleese [20]: How the hell should I know? Let's see here... um, perhaps we, um, could... maybe we, uh – AH! Turrets! Use the turrets!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14B_BossDeath

Kleese [10]: Huzzah! Another obstruction deftly handled. Now, resume running for your lives!

Kleese [20]: It's dead! Hurry back to the ship, on the triple!

Kleese [30]: That's all she wrote, I'm afraid! Now, quickly – back to the ship!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_Outro_1A

Kleese [10]: Crew and cargo safely aboard, Captain! We're ready to go!

Ghalt [20]: You heard him, Nova! Get us the hell outta here!

Mellka [30]: Welp, that's a depressing-as-hell sight. Who wants to drink now?

Ghalt [40]: We did the job, and most of the civilians made it out okay. I'd call that a win.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_Outro_1B

Ghalt [10]: Everyone on board? Good. Nova, take us out!

Mellka [20]: Hey guys? For helpin' me do this... look, I'm not a “thanks and then a big hug” kinda girl, but... thanks, and...

Mellka [20]: (sigh) Who wants a hug?

Ghalt [30]: Rendain can't put 'em down that easy. Not while we're around.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_Outro_1C

Deande [10]: I can't believe it – we pulled it off! What of the Codex? Did we get all of it?

Kleese [20]: Mathematically, no, but I don't think they'll miss what they lost. Alpian pork recipes, mostly.

Mellka [30]: As much as I'd love to see my heritage burn in front of me, let's just get out of here, okay?

Ghalt [40]: You got it, Mell.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_BossRetreat

Kleese [10]: It worked! Now get after it, and finish the job!

Kleese [20]: It... it worked? I mean, yes! Of course it did! Now give chase and seal the deal!

Kleese [30]: Hah! Yes! Run, you coward... bastard... fellow! We're not out of the proverbial woods yet – kill the thing, and then... exit the proverbial woods!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_Health50

Kleese [10]: You've got him now! Keep at it!

Kleese [20]: The monster's in a world of hurt! Continue, you know, applying violence!

Kleese [30]: He's still alive, but, heh, so are you. Don't stop now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_Health80

Kleese [10]: It's working! Keep up the pressure!

Kleese [20]: Don't let up! You're doing great! Or... approaching great! You could do better, of course, but – er, sorry. This is probably not the time.

Kleese [30]: Keep at it! Fight! Live! And so on!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_HostileAttack

Kleese [10]: We got hostiles at the sentry!

Kleese [20]: Hostiles moving to engage Chronicle! Back him up!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_ProjectileTips

Kleese [10]: Shoot those projectiles out of the sky!

Kleese [20]: Destroy those projectiles! Defend the sentry!

Kleese [30]: Take out those projectiles before they hit the sentry!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_SentryTarget

Kleese [10]: Look out! He's targeting Chronicle!

Kleese [20]: He's going after the sentry! Defend it!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_ShieldDown

Kleese [10]: His shield is broken! STRIKE THE KILLING BLOW!

Kleese [20]: Shield's down! Hand the freak his oh-so-freakish ass!

Kleese [30]: The shield has evaporated! Now's your chance!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_TurretAttacked

Kleese [10]: Your turrets are under fire!

Kleese [20]: Protect those turrets! You won't put a dent in the bastard without them!

Kleese [30]: Protect those turrets, damn you!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_TurretDown

Kleese [10]: Turret lost! Bring it back online!

Kleese [20]: We're down one turret!

Kleese [30]: Turret destroyed!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_TurretReminder

Kleese [10]: There are more of those turrets scattered around. Bring them online for additional firepower!

Kleese [20]: Bring more turrets online! Hasten the bastard's demise!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_BossFight_VarelsiAttack

Nova [10]: Chronicle is under attack.

Kleese [10]: The Varelsi are targeting Chronicle! Kill them!

Kleese [20]: Varelsi! At the sentry!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_CombatStart

S1.Chroncile [10]: Hostiles detected?! THIS IS A LIBRARY, YOU MONSTERS!

S1.Chroncile [20]: QUIET! QUIET IN THE LIBRARY!

S1.Chroncile [30]: Hostiles detected! Get ready for the fury of the librarian!

S1.Chroncile [40]: Enemies of life-long learning detected!

S1.Chroncile [50]: The Codex SHALL BE PRESERVED, dammit!

S1.Chroncile [60]: Library science is the DEADLIEST SCIENCE!

S1.Chroncile [70]: Here comes trouble, little learners! I mean, fellas! Sorry, still in tour mode.

S1.Chroncile [80]: Watch out, fellas! Enemies of free thought!

S1.Chroncile [90]: Damn you, this is a LI-BARRY! I mean, LIBRARY!

S1.Chroncile [100]: Have you no SHAME?! This is a LIBRARY!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: CallOut_DataUpdate50

Ghalt [10]: Watch over those couriers! If we lose too many, we lose the Archive!

Kleese [10]: Dammit! We're losing couriers – if we lose too many, we won't be able to reconstruct the Archive!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: CallOut_DataUpdate90

Ghalt [10]: We can't afford to lose any more couriers. Protect 'em!

Kleese [10]: Not good, not good! We're just shy of screwed, everyone! Protect those minions!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: CallOut_MinionsAttack

Nova [10]: Courier minions under attack.

Mellka [10]: The data minions are taking heavy fire! Get over there!

Nova [20]: A band of courier minions is under fire and requires support.

Mellka [20]: Rrrgh – those data minions need some help! Back 'em up!

Nova [30]: Courier minions taking heavy damage.

Mellka [30]: Courier minions under fire! Someone, give 'em a hand!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_MinionSecured

S1.Chroncile [10]: Courier minion secured.

S1.Chroncile [20]: That data is so downloaded. Thanks, little guy.

S1.Chroncile [30]: Ooh! 384,298 cookbooks from Alpia 4. Yeah, this'll be useful. Sure.

S1.Chroncile [40A]: Niiice! A bunch of poems about spiders, written by someone named Mike-comma-Oscar!

Oscar Mike [40B]: THOSE ARE PRIVATE!

S1.Chroncile [50]: Data minion secured.

S1.Chroncile [60]: Alright! One more piece of history, safely ensconced inside of me.

S1.Chroncile [70]: Nice hustle, little guy! Data secured.

S1.Chroncile [80]: Thanks for that, fella!

S1.Chroncile [90]: Climb aboard, little guy!

S1.Chroncile [110]: Data secured. Ooh, erotic novels! I hope they're about sentries.

S1.Chroncile [120]: Alrighty, here's our man!

S1.Chroncile [130]: More data, safely on board.

S1.Chroncile [140]: Data downloaded.

S1.Chroncile [150]: Codex data secured.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Callout_StartEscort

S1.Chroncile [10]: En route to lower docking station.

S1.Chroncile [20]: Heading for docking station alpha.

S1.Chroncile [30]: Follow ol' Chronicle and I'll show you to the docking station.

S1.Chroncile [40]: C'mon, fellas! We got a symbol of LIFE-LONG LEARNING to defend!

S1.Chroncile [50]: Follow me, fellas! We gotta get you to the Grove!

S1.Chroncile [60]: C'mon, fellas! Let's hustle to the Grove before it burns the f**k down!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

name: The Sentinel
text:
|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1A

Mellka [10]: Alright, here we go. According to the Observatory data, the ruins containing the Old Sentinel are just up ahead. And, we're in luck! The Jennerit beat us here! So, we've got that to look forward to! Let's get movin'.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1B

Mellka [10]: Target's in the ruins, just up ahead. You'll have to deal with some hostiles before you get inside, but hey, that's part and parcel to this gig, right? Get moving.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1C

Mellka [10]: The target's in the ruins just up ahead. Get movin'.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_RoadToCamp_1A

Mellka [10]: They're AIRLIFTING units in? Pahahaha! The Sentinel's gonna be piiiissed!

Mellka [20]: If there's one thing I remember from the stories, it's that the Sentinel HATES uninvited guests – so, we'll be going through the front door.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_RoadToCamp_1B

Mellka [10]: Oh, guys! We're in luck. Wanna know WHY I didn't just drop you right at the Sentinel's front door?

Mellka [20]: That's why. The best lessons are the ones that come with an Imperium bodycount. Am I right?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_RoadToCamp_1C

Mellka [10]: Whoa, they're taking a shortcut. Pretty bold! Wonder how the Sentinel's gonna react to that.

Mellka [20]: Yep, he went with violence. (sagely) Just as the prophecy foretold. (chuckles) Nah, I'm just playing with you... or am I? You don't know!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_FindCamp

JenLieutenant [10]: Away team six, report. Have you located the Eldrid weapon?

ThrallTrooper [20]: It's slow going, sir. But I got a good feeling about this corridor. Gotta be around here somewhere...

ThrallTrooper [30]: The walls! Brace the walls, quickly! Before –

JenLieutenant [40]: Team six, come in! Team – rrrgh, DAMN IT!

JenLieutenant [50]: (weary sigh) Fine, that's fine. We'll... try again, that's all. Seventh time's a charm.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_1A

JenLieutenant [10]: Hostiles approaching the excavation site! Kill them!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_1B

Mellka [10]: There's the excavation site! Kill those Jennerit!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_1C

Mellka [10]: There they are! Take 'em out and clear that site!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_2A

Mellka [10]: That shield's gotta go before we can get you inside. The power source has to be somewhere nearby. Take a look around.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_2B

Kleese [10]: I've got a crazy hunch that there's a shard powering that force field. Find it and destroy it!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_2C

Ghalt [10]: Find the shards powering that gate and take 'em out!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_2D

Mellka [10]: Good work. Now we gotta get you inside. Think there's a shard nearby you can blow up?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_ClearCamp_2E

Mellka [10]: I'm guessing we won't have long before reinforcements show up to spoil our party. Let's take care of that shield and get inside. Gotta be a shard around there somewhere, right?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05_DisableGate

Mellka [10]: Alright. Be careful inside – the Eldrid who built this place were very, very different from the kind you're familiar with. Big fans of death-traps, apparently.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_EnterRuin_1A

Mellka [10]: They always said this place was dangerous, but DAMN. Even the Imperium's having a tough time. But I guess we can't turn back now.

Nova [20]: We can and probably ought to turn back now.

Mellka [30]: Hah! She's kidding. Nova's a kidder.

Mellka [30]: (stage whisper) Shut up, Nova!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_EnterRuin_1B

Thorn [10]: When I was a child, Boldur made me promise him I would stay away from these ruins.

Thorn [20]: “It reeks of death, Teshka! Pointy, crushy death!”

Mellka [30]: Yeah, that sounds like Boldur.

Thorn [40]: Then he sealed me inside for three days. Alone. On my birthday.

Mellka [50]: That also sounds like Boldur.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_EnterRuin_1C

Boldur [10]: Teshka, do you remember when Boldur first brought you here?

Thorn [20]: You put a dagger and a flask of water in my hands and left me here for three days. On my birthday.

Boldur [30]: (big laugh) Yes! You ventured forth as little girl. Then you emerged as little girl! But with cool stories!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 06_EnterRuin_1D

Miko [10]: We remember this place. We lost many, many forms exploring it.

Mellka [20]: Cool! So, you remember the layout, right? I bet you know all KINDS of useful stuff about this hell-pit.

Miko [30]: Enough to know that we would much prefer to be outside.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_MainChamber_1A

Mellka [10]: The Sentinel's behind that big gate. If I remember correctly, there's a trick to getting it open.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_MainChamber_1B

Thorn [10]: The mechanisms which open this gate lie deep within the ruins, but the way is perilous. Violent death around every corner... (deep inhale) I am home. Follow me.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_MainChamber_1C

Mellka [10]: The Sentinel's behind that big gate. To open it, we gotta trigger keystones deeper in the ruins. If memory serves, they're at the end of these corridors.

Mellka [10]: Isn't this rad? We're, like, explorers or whatever.

Mellka [10]: Uh, yeah. Focus, mission. Totally. Mission. Mind's on it.

Miko [20]: We know the way. Three mechanisms, guarded by three foes. As to which is first... the choice is ours.

Miko [20A]: We know the way. Two mechanisms, guarded by two foes. As to which is first... the choice is ours.

Mellka [30]: Cool, that was... appropriately cryptic. Thanks, Miko.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07_MainChamber_1D

Boldur [10]: Do not bother punching gate. Boldur has tried many times. Gate must be opened elsewhere, where punching is very effective! Come! Follow Boldur!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07a_ElevatorCombat_1A

Mellka [10]: Huh. Stalled elevator. That's not a good sign.

Ghalt [20]: It's a fair bet that something isn't pleased about your presence there. Prepare yourselves!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 07a_ElevatorCombat_1B

Nova [10]: Elevator powering down. That's probably not good.

Kleese [20]: It's not a mechanical failure – something WANTS you stuck there. Ready yourselves!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_FirstCorridor_1A

Kleese [10]: Rather advanced for “ruins”, aren't they?

Mellka [20]: When it comes to the Eldrid, you gotta rethink the word “ancient”. They've been around for so long... longer than even THEY remember. Stands to reason we used to be pretty great at repelling invaders. Ha! But we sure suck at it now!

Kleese [30]: A shame. Lots of lovely deathtraps in here.

Mellka [40]: I know! The craftsmanship, right? It's a really special kind of hell-pit.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_FirstCorridor_1B

Deande [10]: It's quite beautiful down there – deadly though it may be.

Kleese [20]: Oh, I'm sure I'd think so too, if I spent my whole life staring at gaudy, pointy... triangle-y Jennerit architecture.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08_FirstCorridor_1C

Deande [10]: Mellka, are you familiar with the common lineage shared by the Eldrid and the Jennerit?

Mellka [20]: I've heard a few things.

Deande [30]: I suppose we really AREN'T so different, after all.

Mellka [40]: No, we totally are. For starters, I'm not a s**tbag who represents everything I hate. So I'm gonna get back to this mission, 'kay? Wink!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08A_CrusherRoom_1A

Nova [10]: Ooh, another gate. Maybe there's a cursed amulet or something behind it.

Kleese [20]: Hold tight. I'll see about opening it remotely. Do try not to be, you know, IMPALED by stuff in the meantime.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08A_CrusherRoom_1B

Nova [10]: Kleese? Please stop being lazy and help us open that gate.

Kleese [20]: It's always SOMETHING, isn't it? Stand by.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08A_CrusherRoom_1C

Nova [10]: Ooh, another gate! Now Kleese gets to feel important!

Kleese [20]: It'll just be a moment.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 08b_CrusherRoom_GateOpened

Kleese [10]: Ah, there you are! Proceed to certain death.

Kleese [20]: The way's clear. On you go!

Kleese [30]: Not even ancient Eldrid tech can resist the velvety glove of Gunnar Kleese! The gate is open!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_FirstBossApproach_1A

Mellka [10]: You'll find the first mechanism just up ahead.

Mellka [10]: Anybody else got the feeling like something big and terrifying's gonna come out of the wordwork to kill you the MINUTE you get close?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_FirstBossApproach_1B

Mellka [10]: Now, if the stories are true, we have to seek an audience with the Sentinel's captains before he'll see us himself. Translation? Expect some resistance before you're able to activate those keystones.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_FirstBossApproach_1C

Mellka [10]: I remember something from the stories about the Sentinel having lieutenants – like, if the sentinel was a boss, his lieutenants would be mini-bosses. That's a weird metaphor, but you get the idea – I'm betting you've got a fight ahead of you.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 09_FirstBossApproach_1D

Mellka [10]: Anybody else get the sense that something big, scary, and deadly is waiting for you at the end of this corridor? Yeah, me too. Watch your ass.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 10_FirstKeystone_1A

Mellka [10]: Nice! Now trigger those pads, and that should open the first locking mechanism.

Mellka [20]: Alright. Head back to the main chamber!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_FirstReturn_1A

Mellka [10]: Huh. We're being hailed, but not in any encryption I've ever seen. I'll sic Nova on this – you just keep on keepin' on with that “not dyin'” stuff.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_FirstReturn_1B

Mellka [10]: Hey guys? We're being hailed, but it's – well, I can't make heads or tails of it. I'll have Nova look into it, but just to let you know, we're currently experiencing the digital equivalent of someone whispering in our ear while we're raiding a tomb, so expect skeletons to burst out of the walls at any moment.

Mellka [10]: Hah! Gotcha. Anyway, I'll figure this out.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 11_FirstReturn_1C

Mellka [10]: Cool. I'm being hailed, but the encryption doesn't match the billions of encryptions we know about. That's creepy and weird, and the latest of a long list of things that are creepy and weird about this g**damn hell-pit. (sigh) Nova and I are looking into it.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 12_SecondKickoff

Mellka [10]: Hey, it worked. Get to the next keystone.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13_SecondCorridor_1A

Mellka [10A]: We figured out the deal with that mysterious signal. It's the Old Sentinel! Holy crap, you guys, it's like talking to a superhero! Play it back, Nova.

Mellka [10B]: Well, five-year-old Mellka is losing her mind right now, because that signal from earlier was none other than the Old Sentinel himself. Nova, read 'em the message.

Nova [20A]: “Nobody ever listens. 'Turn back,' I say. 'You'll be crushed to death, and that's painful as hell.' Who are these people? Don't they have, like, jobs or something? Oh, great. They got to the first keystone. Perfect. That's just perfect.”

Nova [20B]: “Awesome. More people trying to get in. What is it about today? Is it a Tuesday? Because I could never get the hang of Tuesdays. Oh well. I guess I'll just have to kill boatloads of unsuspecting hostiles today instead of just the few I had, you know, planned on.”

Nova [20C]: “What the hell's going on outside? It was quiet for, I don't know, a hojillion years or whatever, and all of the sudden everybody's climbing down my throat. This sucks. I'm really mad. This sucks so much.”

Mellka [30]: Can you believe it? Archaeology is f**king NUTS, right?!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_GatePads_1A

Nova [10]: Only one corridor can be opened at a time, so choose wisely. I'd be sad if you died.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 13A_GatePads_1B

Nova [20]: You'll need to fire up one of those pads to open the corresponding path. But only one can be opened at a time.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_SecondBossApproach_1A

Mellka [10]: Cut through whatever's guarding the mechanism and open it up. We gotta keep moving.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_SecondBossApproach_1B

Mellka [10]: I'd bet Kleese's LLC bank account that there's another friggin' golem up ahead. Kill it and trigger the next mechanism. We gotta hurry!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 14_SecondBossApproach_1C

Mellka [10]: Wonder what scary-ass what's-it is gonna try to kill you in there. Well... let's find out, huh?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 15_SecondKeystone_1A

Mellka [10]: And that's two. One more to go!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 16_SecondReturn

Kleese [5]: I say, Mellka – we've received another signal.

Mellka [10]: There's the Sentinel again. Nova, play it back.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 16_SecondReturn_1A

Nova [20A]: “These guys seem... different. They're definitely not Jennerit. Could they be Eldrid? Do they know what's going on outside? I guess it doesn't matter. They'll die just like the rest.”

Nova [20B]: “These guys definitely aren't with those other guys. They sure are weird looking, though. I wonder what sort of noises they make when they die. I bet they're weird too. Like, 'augh!' and, 'squish!' and stuff. I'll make a note of my hypothesis and test it when they are killed.”

Nova [20C]: “They're in the second chamber. Great. More work for me. I have to prepare another underling for imminent mortal combat. It's not like I didn't already have a ton going on today. Argh. Oh, be honest, Sentinel. You haven't had anything going on for thousands of years. I really should start dating again.”

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 17_ThirdKickoff_1A

Mellka [10]: Two down, one more to go. Let's get this done before any more Jennerit crash the party.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 18_ThirdCorridor_1A

Mellka [10]: Nova, can we send a message back to the Sentinel, explain why we've come? Maybe we can reason with it.

Nova [20]: Transmitting. Stand by.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 19_ThirdKeystone_1A

Mellka [10]: One more, and the gate to the Sentinel's chamber should open. Activate it and come on back to the hub – not much further now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 20_ThirdReturn

Mellka [10]: What's it saying, Nova? Did it receive our reply?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 20_ThirdReturn_1A

Nova [20]: Stand by for real-time translation: “That's a cute story. Last Star? Varelsi? I know bulls**t when I smell it. Not that you can tell, but I'm laughing my ass off right now. Ha ha. Ha ha. Ha.”

Nova [20]: Would you like me to translate the rest of his laughter? It goes on for awhile.

Nova [20B]: Stand by for real-time translation: “So you're telling me that a race of cosmic nightmares is dragging stars through the very stuff of space, and we're down to only one? That's the dumbest thing I've ever heard. Also, I don't believe you.”

Nova [20C]: Stand by for real-time translation: “Uh huh. That's rich. Varelsi, huh? Yeah, they sound really scary. About as scary as Garblanthix Ur, the Lord of All Sentinels. Who is fictional, and thus NOT scary.”

Mellka [30]: Enemies of the Eldrid are coming to claim you. They want to use you as a weapon – and we can't let that happen. Any way we can solve this problem without violence?

Mellka [30]: I can't believe I just said that.

Nova [40A]: “Nah, probably not. Even if what you say is true – and it totally isn't – my orders are absolute. I will defend this place. Come and be ground into paste, chumps.”

Nova [40B]: “Without violence? Oh, no. No way in hell. We're doing violence. We are doing that.”

Nova [40C]: “No, I'm not interested in peace. I'm bored as hell. Have been for thousands of years. Security is my only job here, and I'm sure as hell not gonna let you take my job from me. Come and be ground into paste, chumps.”

Mellka [50]: Damn. Well, you heard it. Head for the Sentinel's chamber.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 21_SentinelCorridor_1A

Mellka [10]: I wish there was some other way to keep this thing out of Rendain's reach. But by the sounds of it, the Sentinel's hard-wired for defense. It's not gonna make it easy on us, no matter who we are. I hope you're ready for a fight.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 22_SentinelApproach

Mellka [10]: Whoa. It really IS a weapon – watch out!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 23_SentinelArmorRegen_1A

Mellka [10]: I have a bad feeling about this. He must be regenerating somehow.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 24_SentinelArmorNearComplete_1A

Mellka [10]: Get ready – something's happening!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 25_SentinelArmorComplete_1A

Mellka [20]: He's shedding his armor! Watch out!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 26_MissionEnd_1A

Mellka [10]: We did it. Incredible! One less world-ending superweapon for Rendain to use against us!

Mellka [10]: And we've furthered the Eldrid's inevitable decline. C'mon back to Nova – we're gonna drink now.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 26_MissionEnd_1B

Kleese [10]: I... well, I think that does it. Congratulations, everyone! Rendain won't be laying claim to that artifact anytime soon. Make your way topside, and try not to die along the way, eh?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

name: The Experiment
text:
|| SECTION: 01_Intro_1A

Mellka [10]: Boldur, this is Mellka. Your reinforcements have arrived.
