__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_H

Toby [10]: Reyna? Reyna... is what he said true? Reyna. REYNA?! ANSWER ME RIGHT NOW!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_I

Reyna [10]: Toby, I can explain!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_A

Toby [10]: Reyna – how do you know the Lorrian?

Reyna [20]: My home was under attack, and I wasn't strong enough to defend it. So... I went to the Lorrian for help. After the Heliophage, the Lorrian came to collect. He wanted Fortune's Favor and a fleet as payment. I knew he was up to no good, so I went back on our deal. He said the Rogues would be nothing without him, and he's sort of right! He swore he'd make me pay...

Toby [30]: HE STOLE BERG BECAUSE OF YOU!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_B

Toby [10]: Why didn't you tell me, Reyna?

Reyna [20]: Tell you what? That the leader of the Rogues was a fraud? I'm not like you, Toby – I can't build things. I'm a THIEF – just like the Lorrian, I guess.

Phoebe [30]: Whoa...

Pendles [40]: I know... it's like watching a holo-drama, but with people I was hired to kill.

ISIC [50]: I find it inspiring! She betrayed her friend!

Thaddeus Wishingbone [60]: You should have sided with me, Reyna. It's game over, now. For cereal this time.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_C

Toby [10]: I thought you were the bravest person I knew, Reyna. But you're a fraud.

Pendles [20]: Ouch.

Phoebe [30]: So disappointing.

ISIC [40]: Fraud is such an accurate word!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_D

Toby [10]: Why didn't you tell me you were in trouble? I could've helped you.

Reyna [20]: People saw me as a leader, and leaders don't show weakness.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_E

Toby [10]: Leaders have to show weakness so everyone else knows it's okay to be afraid sometimes! Note to self: inspirational poster idea.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_F1

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: Um, personally I'm finding this all very touching, if a tad melodramatic. But if you insist on destroying my ships, I must stop you.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_F2

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: Also, and this isn't the hugest deal, but I'm sort of the hero, aren't I? I gave you the tools you needed to beat the Varelsi, so if anyone would like to applaud or clap or whatever please do, please do. Oh, thank you, thank you Thaddeus for saving the solar system. You're the emperor that Solus deserves.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_F3

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: Pretty soon there'll be statues of me, and if you just stop destroying my ships maybe I'll have them make a statue of you, too, like, a little one? Just consider it.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_F4

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I have called the statues off.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_F5

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: Bangle Janglejeans.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_G1

Toby [10]: But I can't be mad at you, Reyna... because you just wanted to be stronger, and no one gets that more than me.

Phoebe [20]: Awwwww! That is so cute!

Toby [30]: DON'T SAY CUTE OR I'LL NUKE YOU!

Thaddeus Wishingbone [40]: Uh... hello, scary boss battle occurring.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_G2

Toby [10]: You taught me to stand up for myself.

Thaddeus Wishingbone [20]: I mean, I'm trying to kill you, you know, so pay attention to my lasers and whatnot. You can mend your broken friendships when you're dead.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_G3

Toby [10]: So... I forgive you, Reyna. Now let's trash this guy.

Reyna [20]: I'm so sorry, Toby. I should've trusted you.

Thaddeus Wishingbone [30]: I am SO barfing in this mech suit right now from this semi-touching scene, I hope this suit has an auto-cleaner.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_G4

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: From the icy grip of death's frigid fingers, I will end you.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_H

Reyna [10]: You're a real leader, Toby. I mean that.

Toby [20]: THAT'S RIGHT, I'M THE BEST! Now let's go kill the Lorrian and GET MY MECH SUIT BACK!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_I

Toby [10]: One more ship. It's been a loooong ride, but thanks for sticking it out! Let's do this!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_A

Toby [10]: Okay! You all know what to do!

ISIC [20]: I'm locking down the ship's hyperspace, and... you know what, the point is that the Lorrian won't be able to escape this time!

Phoebe [30]: Blocking all frequencies!

Pendles [40]: I'll kill anyone who tries to escape. And anyone who doesn't if the fee's to my liking!

Reyna [50]: Alright Rogues, let's —

Reyna [50]: No. Toby – this is your mission now. You say it.

Toby [60]: WE'RE COMIN', BERG!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_B

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: You're too late, Toby. I've un-encrypted the final piece of your mech suit, and my army is ready to land. Now I've got something to say.

Thaddeus Wishingbone [20]: I am the Lorrian. I have existed since the dawn of time – practically – and I will rule Solus. I am the bug in your ear. I am the last drop of water. I am, and have always been, the rightful ruler of the universe. 'Kay?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_C

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I will make Rendain look like a party favor, and not the good kind like candy, but the bad kind, like when you get a pencil eraser.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_D

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: My plan is almost complete. Okay? Soon I will exert my dominance over Solus, and all will know my name. Or whatever name I choose cause I had like ten.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_E

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: Uh, Solus will either kneel before me, or die before me, it really doesn't matter, if I'm honest.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_F1

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I am the Lorrian. Without me, you'd be nothing! You hear that, Reyna Valeria and Toby... Penguin... guy?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_F2

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I will not clean your corpses from my floor but laminate and preserve them, so when kindergarteners tour the historic ship that started my reign they will reach for you with their snot-glazed fingers. Bladow!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_F3

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I am the crusty bits of sleep that annoy you when you wake. I am the silent moth who waits for the moonlight. I am the coffee creamer gone slightly bad but you have no other option and must drink me.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_F4

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I am all things. I am your doom. I am the past. I am your destiny. I am the future. I am the emperor of Solus.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_F5

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: The Lorrian.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_G1

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I will destroy the Jennerit, the Peacekeepers, the LLC, the Eldrid, the ROGUES! And my reign will be all thanks to you, Toby.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_G2

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: Your children's children will polish statues of me as part of unpaid internships!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_G3

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: No! It cannot be! I am the Lorrian. I am invincible. I am cold. I am frightened. I am so frightened.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_G4

Thaddeus Wishingbone [10]: I am friendless. I have regrets. I am only two hole punches away from a free ice cream. I am... Thaddeus Wishingbone. Ice cream... I want... ice cream... strawberry... please, mother... please.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_H

Toby [10]: We did it!

Reyna [20]: You did it, Toby. You did it.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_I

Toby [10]: BERG! I missed you!

ISIC [20]: Congrats, Toby! You are now my best and only friend!

Phoebe [30]: Well, that was an ordeal! Congratulations, Toby. You might have a future in the LLC.

Pendles [40]: Later, Tobes. Next time I see ya, I'm gonna kill ya. Just kidding, mate.

Reyna [50]: Well, Toby. Anything to say? Permission to shout.

Toby [60]: Thank you, thank you, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

name: DLC_BattleSchool
text:
|| SECTION: BinkIntro

Oscar Mike [10]: Dear diary, new entry! Subject: internal conflict! Ghalt wants me to reopen contact with the other Mikes. I'm excited to see them, but I'm worried they'll still be mad at me. What if they turn me away?

Oscar Mike [20]: You know what? No! You can't keep a Mike down! They kicked me out, but I'm gonna kick myself right back in! Thanks for the pick-me-up, diary! Mike out!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro01

Nova [10]: Welcome to Battleborn Operations, the biggest thing since using a particle accelerator to slice bread. You have selected Oscar Mike vs. the Battle School. Hope you're down with the whole clone thing, because wow, it can be a lot to deal with sometimes.

Nova [20]: Throughout the operation, you'll have opportunities to earn Ops Points, up to a maximum of fifty for your first playthrough. Increased Ops Points means higher difficulty and greater rewards such as titles and customizations.

Nova [30]: Good luck. Beginning operation in three, two, one...

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro02

Nova [10]: Welcome back. Can't get enough of the Battle School, huh? I don't blame you. Since this is your second playthrough, you will now begin with five Ops Points and be able to reach a maximum of fifty-five. Earning forty Ops Points will unlock a new skin for your character, and there are even greater rewards later on.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro03

Nova [10]: You again! This is your third playthrough, so you will begin with ten Ops Points and can reach a maximum of sixty. If you haven't already, you can earn a new character skin at forty and a title at fifty. Get all the way to sixty, and you'll unlock a Commander Loot Pack!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro04

Nova [10]: Welcome back to Battleborn Operations. I think you know the deal at this point. Be sure to earn and/or pick up those Ops Points, because they ramp up the difficulty and get you sweeter loot.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_FirstWave

GeneralMike [10]: You must clear the room of enemies in order to advance, or else be obliterated in the man-barbecue of combat!

GeneralMike [20]: Well done! We now have exact knowledge of where the line between failure and pathetic technical victory lies.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_SecondWave

GeneralMike [10]: You have so far comported yourself just above mediocrity. This will be an advanced test of your martial prowess!

GeneralMike [20]: Area clear! I must begrudgingly admit that your aptitude is within satisfactory limits.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_ThirdWave

GeneralMike [10]: If you cannot withstand just three rounds in the gauntlet, how can you hope to protect the brothers and sister-brothers fighting at your side?

GeneralMike [20]: I didn't think you'd make it this far! In fact, I don't think you did! Who are you, impostor?!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_BossFight

GeneralMike [10]: A true Mike knows that his greatest enemy always comes at the END of the mission! Sic 'em, sentry!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: ProdLines

GeneralMike [10]: Hurry up, soldier! The Battle School waits for no Mike!

GeneralMike [20]: How do you expect to pass the test if you can't even find it?! Make your way to the combat simulator!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_A

GeneralMike [10]: OM83-1101? I thought you were dead to me! What in the high thread count linens of King Mike's summer palace's eighth guest bedroom do you think you're doing here? You're still exiled.

Oscar Mike [20]: Sir, I am exercising my right to a Trial by Elaborate Obstacle Course, sir! I'm saluting! In case you can't see.

GeneralMike [30]: I can hear a salute through the radio – just like I can hear the softness in your glutes! But I see you've been reading the Clonestitution, and I respect that! Alright, OM83-1101, I'll give you your shot. Step forward and enter... the Battle School!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_B

GeneralMike [10]: This is our Combat Readiness Gauntlet. We send every new Mike in here, fresh from the vats. Don't even give them armor! I really want you to think about that. Think about how many naked, amniotic gel-glazed Mikes have earned their first combat kills right here in this very room!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_C

GeneralMike [10]: The Kingdom of Mikes has thrived in your absence, OM83-1101. We've rebuilt everything since the veiling of Planet Mike! Ours is now a society of artists, philosophers, and tradesmen!

Oscar Mike [20]: You mean... there are Mikes that aren't soldiers?

GeneralMike [30]: Every Mike is a soldier, soldier! You'd do well to remember that! Baker Mike experiences combat every day! His enemy: empty bellies, and his ammunition: croissants so buttery and flaky as to make a grown Thrall weep!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_D

GeneralMike [10]: I was invited to King and Queen Mike's black-armor masquerade ball tonight! I could be eating Charcuterie Mike's finest Swarmer pâté on tiny little crackers, but instead I'm here babysitting a deserter.

Oscar Mike [20]: Huh. Do you put the masks on over the helmet, or... like, somewhere else?

GeneralMike [30]: Well, now I'll never know, will I?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_E

Oscar Mike [10]: Sir? Uh... how many Mikes survived from Planet Mike?

GeneralMike [20]: I was able to get King and Queen Mike onboard a shuttle, along with a single cloning vat, and escape the planet just before it was veiled! We had to start again from scratch, the last three Mikes in the universe.

Oscar Mike [30]: But I could've helped!

GeneralMike [40]: The key to a good banishment is completely forgetting the person isn't dead, and then not caring.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_F

GeneralMike [10]: Well fought, OM83-1101. You are ten percent of the way to your reinstatement.

Oscar Mike [20]: Ten percent? But, I beat the trial fair and square, sir! And I'm still salutin'!

GeneralMike [30]: I am exercising my Clonestitutional right to overly complex bureaucracy!

Oscar Mike [40]: Aw, man! I hate the Seven Hundred and Seventy-Threeth Amendment!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_A

GeneralMike [10]: Back for more, OM83-1101? I'm a little surprised.

Oscar Mike [20]: Sir, you can call me Oscar, sir!

GeneralMike [30]: The only person I call by their first name is my wife, and even THAT was only after she bested me in single combat. Rachael, darling, say hi.

RachaelMike [40]: Hey.

GeneralMike [50]: She's a sweetheart. Anyway, get in the death room!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_B

GeneralMike [10]: We designed this combat testing chamber with the goal of preparing soldiers for any locale in the known universe.

GeneralMike [10]: Pretty easy since there's only three planets left.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_C

Oscar Mike [10]: So, uh, Rachael, what do you do?

RachaelMike [20]: I'm the assistant director at the Royal Mike Ballet. We focus on neoclassical performances that evoke the bolder, more aggressive traditions like the kind you might have seen on Lenore-era Jennar, with a higher emphasis on individual freedom of motion over synchronized group arrangements.

Oscar Mike [30]: Oh. That's cool.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_D

Oscar Mike [10]: How'd you guys meet?

GeneralMike [20]: She was arranging a grand gala for King and Queen Mike's anniversary celebration, and I was there as head of security. We met while doing pushups in line for the punch bowl. It was love at first ironsights.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_E

RachaelMike [10]: We get along really well, and we have a lot of the same hobbies. Plus, he's from an earlier clone batch, and I've always had a thing for older Mikes.

GeneralMike [20]: You're the love of my life, darling!

RachaelMike [30]: You're so sweet!

Oscar Mike [40]: (sobbing) Love... is so... beautiful!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_F

Oscar Mike [10]: I'm really happy for you guys! It's like... you were made for each other!

GeneralMike [20]: Thank you, Osc... OM83-1101! Now quit tryin' to butter me up! You've still got 80% of your appeal to fight through! Get a move on, soldier!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar03_A

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: Alright you dweebs, what's going on here? You having a family reunion or something?

GeneralMike [20]: Audible gasp! You're one of the defectives! I didn't know any had survived.

Oscar Mike [30]: That's Whiskey. He can be a little bit of a total jerk, but he also kicks ass! So... net positive!

Whiskey Foxtrot [40]: You're damn right I kick ass. What's this wussy playground all about? Ever turn it up past pre-school level? Hah!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar03_B

GeneralMike [10]: I'll have you know this “wussy playground” is the finest combat simulator in Solus!

Whiskey Foxtrot [20]: More like wuss simulator!

GeneralMike [30]: What was that?!

Whiskey Foxtrot [40]: You heard me!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar03_C

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: You guys think this is hard?! I'm glad I got rejected, or I'd be BORED out of my MIND with you Mikes!

Oscar Mike [20]: You sure? You could join in on my appeal, and try to get into the Mikes again too!

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: Ahh, I'm not really a joiner.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar03_D

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: What's there even to do in the Mikes? Are you guys even a functioning society? You guys probably don't even have a crudball team!

GeneralMike [20]: We have three! There's the Mad Mikes, the Mikes of Fury, and the Irate Marks.

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: You mean Mikes?

GeneralMike [40]: Yeah! What did I say?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar03_E

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: Well, what about art? Do you guys have your own music?

GeneralMike [20]: Of course! Bassoon Mike and Drummer Mike have been hosting Open Mike night every month at our local watering hole: the Olde Mangy Mike. You see, it's short for microphone and it also --

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: Yep. Got there without a map.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar03_F

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: Alright, I admit you guys are a lot farther along than I thought you'd be. Still, I'd rather be the cook for the Rogues than be the smartest of you lot.

GeneralMike [20]: Cook? They don't even have you on the front lines?

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: I mean, well, sometimes they need my help with some--

GeneralMike [40]: Ha! HA! That is a knee-slapper! OM83-1101, make a note that I just slapped my knee!

Oscar Mike [50]: “Slapped... knee...”

Whiskey Foxtrot [60]: Ugh, I hate you guys.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar04_A

Oscar Mike [10]: Sir, I have a confession to make, sir! My only copy of the Clonestitution is an audiobook.

GeneralMike [20]: The audiobook is held in high regard within Mike culture! Unless it's one of those low-budget ones that only uses one voice actor!

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: I hate that!

Oscar Mike [40]: I know, right?

GeneralMike [50]: Right?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar04_B

GeneralMike [10]: As you know, it is the Clonestitutional duty of every Mike to keep themselves at peak combat performance levels at all times! No exceptions! Well, not counting Fat Mike.

FatMike [20]: I contribute moral support!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar04_C

FatMike [10]: Mmm! Oh man. These croissants are just killer, Baker Mike! What's your secret?

BakerMike [20]: You have to let the butter get cold in the refrigerator before you layer it into the dough. If it's too warm, it loses shape and you don't get those delicious fluffy pockets inside as the croissant bakes!

FatMike [30]: Genius!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar04_D

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: Hey, Baker Mike. Uh... do you have any pro tips to avoid overproofing my sourdough? It always comes out too dense and I just get so f***ing g*ddamned angry!

BakerMike [20]: Easy, my friend! Try not to over-score your loaves or proof them longer than an hour! Otherwise, the gluten inside has too much time to relax and won't have the structural integrity necessary to give it that springiness you want.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar04_E

GeneralMike [10]: Baker Mike, I tried to make the wife a soufflé for Mikentine's Day, but it fell as soon as I put it on the table!

BakerMike [20]: That's no fault of your own, General. All souffles fall a few minutes out of the oven, it's actually a good sign that you didn't overmix your batter.

GeneralMike [30]: That's a relief! Thanks, Baker Mike!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar04_F

BakerMike [10]: The secret to good baking is to keep experimenting. All it takes is determination, patience, and a lot of practice. Ohohoho!

Oscar Mike [20]: Wow, I feel like I learned a lot!

GeneralMike [30]: There's no reason that combat training can't also be educational!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar05_A

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: I'm back, you dinguses! What's new?

GeneralMike [20]: Whiskey Foxtrot! Did you finish peeling your potatoes and dicing your carrots?

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: First of all, carrots should be julienned, and second of all, SHUT UP!

GeneralMike [40]: We were going to do some combat training, but feel free to tell us all about tonight's menu.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar05_B

Oscar Mike [10]: Oooh, ooh-ooh, let me guess! Are we having lentil stew again?

Whiskey Foxtrot [20]: Close! It's a curried squash bisque with chive-infused harresbura yogurt!

GeneralMike [30]: Nerd.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar05_C

Oscar Mike [10]: Hey, Whiskey, why DID you get rejected from the RDC?

Whiskey Foxtrot [20]: I dunno, they were probably afraid I'd eat you guys or somethin'. Everyone's always afraid I'm gonna eat them! Seriously, I don't eat people!

GeneralMike [30]: I remember hearing rumors about the Foxtrot batch. They rejected them for being too emotional.

Whiskey Foxtrot [40]: What? No! Shut up! You're emotional!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar05_D

Oscar Mike [10]: Emotions, huh? Is that why you're always hangin' out with that Jennerit lady?

GeneralMike [20]: Jennerit?! Foxtrot, have you been leaking information to the enemy? That's grounds for treason!

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: Easy, guys, it's not like that. It's, uh... well, you know...

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar05_E

Oscar Mike [10]: What do you and Deande even DO together, anyway? She doesn't even have a gun! Ha!

Whiskey Foxtrot [20]: Heh. What do you think we do, you idiots?

GeneralMike [30]: Seriously. We have no idea. We've been trying to figure it out for days now.

Oscar Mike [40]: Yeah, I got nothin'.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar05_F

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: Never thought I'd be having this talk. Uh, you see... when two people have feelings for each other, sometimes they, um... whooo, um...

GeneralMike [20]: Call in airstrikes together?

FatMike [30]: Share a pound cake?

Oscar Mike [40]: Ooh! Write poems to each other!

Whiskey Foxtrot [50]: Ugh. Yeah. Those things.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar06_A

HeraldMike [10]: Hear ye, hear ye! The royal personage does hark upon these very halls!

GeneralMike [20]: Audible gasp! The queen herself! Quick! Everybody bow!

QueenMike [30]: General! I hear you are giving an exile a runthrough of the gauntlet. I thought I might observe.

Oscar Mike [40]: Ma'am, it is an honor --

QueenMike [50]: By the creme of Baker Mike's cannolis! Oscar, you are ALIVE?!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar06_B

QueenMike [10]: Do you not remember? It is I, OM91-0519! We were on the same infantry tug in the Garden Campaign!

Oscar Mike [20]: Bro! It's so good to see you! I didn't know YOU were Queen Mike! This is awesome!

GeneralMike [30]: Heh! Okay! Great! Let's, uh... let's get this round started.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar06_C

Oscar Mike [10]: How did YOU end up as Queen Mike?

QueenMike [20]: KM51-0541 and I co-wrote the Clonestitution together! He took King and I took Queen. It just felt right, you know? Curious, how DID you get exiled?

GeneralMike [30]: Uh oh! Looks like the next wave is starting! Better get in there!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar06_D

GeneralMike [10]: Ma'am, I must inform you that OM83-1101 was cast out of the Mikes for joining the Peacekeepers after Planet Mike was settled.

QueenMike [20]: Oscar, is this true? You joined back up with those jerks? After the way they treated us?

Oscar Mike [30]: They weren't all jerks! My best bro Montana fought with us in the Garden campaign!

QueenMike [40]: Tiny headed fellow! Yes! I adore that guy!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar06_E

QueenMike [10]: Why did YOU not stay with us, Oscar? We were building a new society!

Oscar Mike [20]: It all kinda happened at once, I guess. I was helping you guys settle Planet Mike, then General Mike told me I couldn't stay AND be part of the UPR, too. Montana was my best bro, and the Clonestitution clearly states never to leave a bro hangin'!

QueenMike [30]: (sniff) Those words... those words are as true today as when I wrote them!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar06_F

QueenMike [10]: General Mike... you were right to exile Oscar Mike for dereliction of duty!

GeneralMike [20]: Phew! Awesome, okay, was getting worried there.

QueenMike [30]: But Oscar Mike, you embodied the true spirit of Mike when you stuck by your bro. General, what was the original duration of his trial?

GeneralMike [40]: Ten rounds through the gauntlet, ma'am!

QueenMike [50]: Very well, Oscar Mike. I am commuting your trial down to four.

Oscar Mike [60]: But I already did six of 'em!

GeneralMike [70]: And now you've just got four more to go, OM83-1101!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar07_A

Oscar Mike [10]: General, sir! I have a question: how does a Mike choose their role in Mike culture? Is it assigned?

GeneralMike [20]: Negative, soldier! Each Mike is encouraged from day zero to explore who and what they are! Some drive themselves to greatness in a single field. Others choose to be more well-rounded Mikes-of-all-trades. Not to be confused with Trader Mike. Who is not to be confused with Traitor Mike.

Oscar Mike [30]: Nope, I'm... I'm definitely confused.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar07_B

GeneralMike [10]: We were created to be soldiers. It is etched into our brains to excel on the battlefield, as basic as eating, sleeping, or that one dream where you're eating an entire truck.

Oscar Mike [20]: I KNEW I couldn't be the only one!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar07_C

GeneralMike [10]: Don't you ever wonder, OM83-1101, whether you feel something because of who you are, or do those feelings come from what you were programmed to be?

Oscar Mike [20]: I always figured that if I'm doing the wondering, then that means I've already grown past the bounds of my own creation. To question is to exist, sir!

GeneralMike [30]: Wait, really? You've thought that?

Oscar Mike [40]: Naw, I'm quoting Bradathon from “One Star To Live”. It's my favorite holo-drama!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar07_D

GeneralMike [10]: The keystone of Mike culture is willful individuality! Our bodies are all identical and pre-programmed with the same knowledge – we do not have the luxury of a blank slate! Our lives are not written on fresh paper, but in red ink on the margins of a half-started manuscript!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar07_E

Oscar Mike [10]: So I could be anything I want?

GeneralMike [20]: Of course not! You have to be good at it! Well, except for Loan Shark Mike.

LoanSharkMike [30]: Hey, either of you want this shark? I'll need it back at some point, but you can keep it for now.

GeneralMike [40]: Still not what that means, buddy.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar07_F

Oscar Mike [10]: I mean, when I join you guys, can I still be Oscar? Would I have to be... uh... Push-Up Mike, or Poetry Mike?

GeneralMike [20]: Of course not!

Oscar Mike [30]: That's a relief, I wouldn't want to be shoehorned into --

GeneralMike [40]: Those are already taken! In fact, Push-Up Mike has been going this entire time. I accidentally told her to drop and give me “twenteen”, and now she's just goin' until she gets there!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_A

GeneralMike [10]: Guiding you through this combat gauntlet is monotonous! I'm going to turn on one of my favorite pod-holos and coast through this one. I might still yell at you occasionally. That cool?

Oscar Mike [20]: All good with me!

BakerMike [30]: Welcome back to Cloning Scones! I'm your host Baker Mike, and joining us today is a very special guest: it's our favorite regent, Queen Mike!

QueenMike [40]: Thank you, Baker Mike. It is so nice to be here today.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_B

GeneralMike [10]: Cloning Scones is the best! I can get all the hottest baking tips (pun intended) and they've been attracting bigger guest stars recently!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_C

BakerMike [10]: So, Queen Mike, tell me about this recipe you brought in.

QueenMike [20]: Well Baker Mike, Lemon-Lime Meringue Pie is an old favorite in the Royal Palace. It requires three gallons of Go-Go Juice, and has a wonderfully flaky crust to provide the energy for success each and every morning.

BakerMike [30]: Delightful!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_D

QueenMike [10]: The key to a fizzy pie is to use the freshest lemon-lime flavored Go-Go Juice available. Since the production facility was veiled several decades ago, that means you will have to perservere and find a hidden cache, or purchase such a cache from someone else.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_E

QueenMike [10]: The traditional Lemon-Lime Meringue Pie, as first conceived by the Lorrians, utilized aviant eggs for the topping. Obviously, this shameful tradition is frowned upon in our modern society. Therefore, we made a better topping! A synthetic topping! Made with a protein slurry manufactured right here in this facility!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar08_F

QueenMike [10]: Just twenty minutes in a four-hundred degree oven will give you those perfect golden neon peaks that remind you of the first days of your post-vat Mikehood.

BakerMike [20]: Absolutely wonderful, thank you so much for joining us, Queen Mike.

QueenMike [30]: It was my pleasure, Baker Mike.

GeneralMike [40]: “Four hundred... degrees.” Alright! Gotta try this one out! Good job on the fighting and whatever, too.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_A

GeneralMike [10]: OM83-1101! You are almost to the final test! Do you believe you have the Mikeness to persevere?

Oscar Mike [20]: Sir, I do, sir!

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: Oscar! What are you doing?! You don't need these guys to fit in! They're talkin' all this crap about individuality, and then excluding you!

GeneralMike [40]: Shut up, reject! You don't know anything about belonging!

Oscar Mike [50]: Guys! Stop fighting!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_B

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: I'd rather belong to a group of misfits like the Rogues than a bunch of prissy airheads like you!

GeneralMike [20]: Of course you would! They have no respect for the order of law, nor desire to better themselves. Easy to fit in when nothing is asked of you!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_C

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: The Rogues would never ask me to change who I am just to be part of some greater society! They value me for who I am already!

GeneralMike [20]: Value you so much that they put you in the kitchen, huh? You think that's because they like your bisque? They're afraid of you!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_D

Whiskey Foxtrot [10]: Maybe that's what I like, huh? Maybe I like being feared! That's what gets you respect! Honor and teamwork is just a bunch of words for everyone agreeing not to kill each other for now!

GeneralMike [20]: Would it help if I said I do fear you? That you scare the armored pants right off me?

Whiskey Foxtrot [30]: Yeah. Actually, that would help a lot.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_E

Oscar Mike [10]: Sounds like you just want to be appreciated, Whiskey!

Whiskey Foxtrot [20]: Yeah! That's all! I just want people to think I might rip them in half at a moment's notice! Is that so much to ask?!

GeneralMike [30]: I absolutely already think that.

Whiskey Foxtrot [40]: Well, alright, then!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar09_F

GeneralMike [10]: Whiskey Foxtrot, I have been consulting the Clonestitution, and I believe it would be within Mike law to allow OM83-1101's appeal for reinstatement to also apply to you.

Whiskey Foxtrot [20]: Well, I've done a lot of thinking and soul-searching, and I've decided to tell you to shove your inclusion and family love up your --

Oscar Mike [30]: Whoa, w-what Whiskey is trying to say, sir, is that he needs to sit on it for a little longer!

Whiskey Foxtrot [40]: You can sit on --

Oscar Mike [50]: Okay! Think we're all done here! Movin' on!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_A

GeneralMike [10]: This is it, OM83-1101! Your final run through the gauntlet!

Oscar Mike [20]: I couldn't have done it without the help of all my friends! And also the bullets in my gun! You know, when you think about it, friends are like rounds in a magazine.

GeneralMike [30]: That simile makes no sense, soldier! Get your act together!

Oscar Mike [40]: Yeah, I'll work on it.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_B

Oscar Mike [10]: Friends are like... napalm! You just can't shake 'em off, no matter how hard you try!

GeneralMike [20]: Getting better.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_C

BakerMike [10]: Maybe friends are like croissants, rising in the oven together! Even if they are all made from the same recipe, they are each unique inside!

FatMike [20]: And you can never have too many!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_D

RachaelMike [10]: Maybe friends are like dancers on stage, performing in tandem to inspire others toward greatness!

Whiskey Foxtrot [20]: Or friends could be like a sous-vide, which takes a long time to get right, but once you put in that time they're exactly what you wanted!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_E

QueenMike [10]: I believe friends are like subjects – always adoring you and never, ever questioning your orders.

LoanSharkMike [20]: You sure you don't want this shark, your highness?

QueenMike [30]: What did I just say?!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar10_F

GeneralMike [10]: I believe TRUE friendship is about bringing out the best in the people you care for. OM83-1101... Oscar Mike... you have shown that you are a true Mike. You have braved the gauntlet and torn a new victory from the hands of your old defeat. We welcome you back into the fold as one of us. Now, what did you come to ask us anyway?

Oscar Mike [20]: My boss wanted to know if you guys would help us save the universe.

GeneralMike [30]: Oh! Yeah, sure! We haven't had a good war in years. We'd have done that anyway. Coulda just asked that to start.

Oscar Mike [40]: No regrets! Unh!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Flavor_Bots

GeneralMike [10]: Thanks to a new green initiative, we're already recycling the wreckage of the bots you've killed. If you die, we'll put your pulpy residue to use too! With a little cayenne, I think we can pass you off as a red pepper bisque.

GeneralMike [20]: Using these robots as target practice technically violates manufacturer safety protocols. Take that, kindergarten culture!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Flavor_Thrall

GeneralMike [10]: Who can't handle a few rampaging Thrall? What are you, a baby? I've never even SEEN a baby! Not once!

GeneralMike [20]: That's Grade Q Premium Thrall beef coming right at you, chuggalump!

GeneralMike [20]: Sorry, I blacked out, I have no idea what I just said!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Flavor_Varelsi

GeneralMike [10]: Some say the Varelsi feed on souls. Luckily, you were incubated before we invented the soul injector, so you should be fine!

GeneralMike [20]: Hurry up and frag those V's soldier! What are you waiting for, the end of the universe?

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_Any

GeneralMike [10]: Bonus objective! If there is one constant in this ever-shifting universe, it is this: explosive barrels are everywhere! Destroy five in this round!

GeneralMike [20]: Bonus objective! Build two turrets this round! That's one more than one, and one less than... uh, just build two turrets!

GeneralMike [30]: Bonus objective! Build a drone to assist you, and care for it as if you were its parent! That last part isn't quantifiable, but I'm watchin' you!

GeneralMike [40]: Bonus objective! Spawn one of them big minion bots! I love watching them walk around! Hah!

GeneralMike [50]: Bonus objective! Get into this big one's face! Kill it with a melee strike!

GeneralMike [60]: Bonus objective! That thing doesn't look so tough! Kill it with a melee strike!

GeneralMike [70]: Bonus objective! Don't die! So... I guess, same goal as ever, but this time there's Ops Points on the line!

GeneralMike [80]: Bonus objective! Do this round without taking damage! I double-Mike dare you!

GeneralMike [90]: Bonus objective! A Mike knows when he's on his own! Build no turrets or drones this round!

GeneralMike [100]: Bonus objective! Reach that button and melee it! It's been a bad, bad button!

GeneralMike [110]: Bonus objective! Skip leg day? You'll be punished summarily! Until then, you'll have to jump through hoops to impress me! Literally!

GeneralMike [120]: Bonus objective! I've been livestreaming this to the MikeNet, but NOW they want me to put ads up! I'd rather you destroy the cameras than sell out! Do it!

GeneralMike [130]: Bonus objective! These BoomBots are as lethal to their friends as they are to you! Use them to take out your enemies!

GeneralMike [140]: Bonus objective! Those explosive barrels are only there for decoration! They really bring the whole room together! I just changed my mind – blow them up and make sure they damage someone while they're doin' it!

GeneralMike [150]: Bonus objective! Explosive barrels are all around you! I sleep with one under my pillow! Not for protection, it just reminds me of home! Use them to defeat your enemies!

GeneralMike [160]: Bonus objective! I didn't come here to see a snipe-fest! Get in close and melee your enemies into submission!

GeneralMike [170]: Bonus objective! Speedrun! Destroy this wave before the timer hits zero!

GeneralMike [180]: Bonus objective! Speedrun! Clear this round before the timer hits zero!

GeneralMike [190]: Bonus objective! Build two turrets to defend yourself! Do your part to stimulate the Mike economy!

GeneralMike [200]: Bonus objective! I put up these hoops to play crudball, and dang if I'm not all about sustainable re-use! Jump through those hoops, soldier!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_A

GeneralMike [10]: Bonus objective! Family should stay together! Destroy those twins simultaneously!

GeneralMike [20]: Bonus objective! You have sixty seconds to destroy those Henchmen duplicates! Get a move on!

GeneralMike [30]: Bonus objective! You have sixty seconds to destroy the remaining Henchman Duplicate! Get a move on!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_B

GeneralMike [10]: Bonus objective! Kill that Shaman before it summons a second wave of enemies! Do it!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_C

GeneralMike [10]: Bonus objective! Pop that Devourer's head! Don't worry, that'll be Janitor Mike's problem!

GeneralMike [20]: Bonus objective! Don't get blinded by that Varelsi Dancer's bubble! On the double! Or you're in trouble!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_D

GeneralMike [10]: Bonus objective! Stay away from those build nodes! They're one-use-only, and we have to replace them every time! I'm on a budget here!

GeneralMike [20]: Bonus objective! Hope you like punchin' spiders! I know I do. Finish off that sentry with a melee strike!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_E

GeneralMike [10]: Bonus objective! Use the lay of the land to your advantage! Knock some enemies into those pits!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_Success

Nova [10]: General Mike is pleased. Ops Points awarded.

Nova [20]: You really blew General Mike away with that one. Ops Points awarded.

Nova [30]: General Mike has begrudgingly awarded you some Ops Points.

Nova [40]: I've been authorized by General Mike to award you some Ops Points.

Nova [50]: General Mike said you didn't deserve a reward, but here's some Ops Points on the down-low.

Nova [60]: General Mike is impressed. Ops Points awarded.

Nova [70]: General Mike will remember that. Ops Points awarded.

Nova [80]: General Mike would love to congratulate you himself, but he seems busy. Ops Points awarded.

Nova [90]: General Mike approves of your skills. Ops Points awarded.

Nova [100]: I don't care what General Mike says, you earned that one. Ops Points awarded.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Side_Arena_Fail

Nova [10]: General Mike would like you to know that he knew you'd never succeed.

Nova [20]: General Mike told me to say this: “loser loser, ha-ha, loser ha-ha, loser ha.”

Nova [30]: General Mike is shaking his head slowly in disappointment. Seriously, I'm looking right at him.

Nova [40]: General Mike has instructed me to communicate the following: “whomp whomp.”

Nova [50]: General Mike said I should play a trombone if you fail, but I'm not sure he understands that I can't use physical objects, so... whomp whomp whomp.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: SentryLines

S1.Wolf [10]: Mom! Dad! I'm finally home! That death march was way longer than I expected!

S1.Wolf [20]: Ohhhh! I came back wrong! I saw things! Old things!

Geoff [30]: Arachnis time! The king is back, baby!

Geoff [40]: I gots to spider this place up!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

name: DLC_DemonBear
text:
|| SECTION: BinkIntro

Montana [10]: Ah! This is the life! Fresh air! The outdoors! Friends around a campfire, tellin' stories!

WaterMonk [20]: You've just been pointing to individual muscles on your chest and giving them names.

Montana [30]: Well, now you've gone and made Hector the Pectoral sad, but, okay. You're gonna love this one. This story's got it all. Mystery. Adventure. A jumping section. Prepare yourself for... the Tale of the Demon Bear!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro01

Nova [10]: Welcome to Battleborn Operations, brought to you in part by the accelerated death of the universe. You have selected Montana and the Demon Bear. Looks like these guys are enjoying a camping trip while I'm in drydock for repairs. Is it still a drydock when everything is dry in space? I'm not going to dwell on it.

Nova [20]: Throughout the operation, I'll alert you to opportunities to earn Ops Points, up to a maximum of fifty for your first playthrough. Increased Ops Points means higher difficulty and greater rewards such as titles and customizations.

Nova [30]: Good luck. Beginning operation in three, two, one...

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro02

Nova [10]: Welcome back! Hope you're ready for another thrilling tale of adventure. You will now begin with five Ops Points and be able to reach a maximum of fifty-five. Earning forty Ops Points will unlock a new skin for your character, and there are even greater rewards later on.

Nova [20]: Now that that's all cleared up, let's go see what the gang is up to. Beginning operation in three... two... one...

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro03

Nova [10]: You again! Well, I never. This is your third playthrough, so you will begin with ten Ops Points and can reach a maximum of sixty. If you haven't already, you can earn a new character skin at forty and a title at fifty. Get all the way to sixty, and you'll unlock a Commander Loot Pack!

Nova [20]: All set? Operation will begin in three... two... one...

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Ops_Intro04

Nova [10]: Welcome back to Battleborn Operations. You're a regular here, so I probably don't need to tell you to earn Ops Points in order to raise the difficulty and get cooler loot. But I did anyway.

Nova [20]: Storytime starts in three... two... one...

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 01_Beacons

Nova [10]: Watch out! The Jennerit have found us!

Nova [20]: Without my processing core, I'm not a great shot. But let's try anyway. Missile incoming!

Nova [30]: Whoops. Did I blow you up? If not, try and activate those targeting beacons so I can take out that hover tank.

Nova [40]: One beacon online. Three more to go.

Nova [50]: Two beacons online.Two more left.

Nova [60]: Three beacons online, just one more.

Nova [70]: All beacons online. Now activate that central targeting computer so I can take down the hover tank!

Nova [80]: Target acquired. I hope. Missiles away, en-route to target.

Nova [90]: I'll take that enormous kaboom to mean it worked. Go get my core back! Hurry!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 02_JumpChasm

Nova [10]: Looks like the bear ran into that old sap refinery. That chasm is too wide to jump – you'll have to find another way around!

Nova [20]: There's one of her cubs! Get it!

Nova [30]: Looks like the cub forgot to close the portal behind it. Go ahead, jump in!

Nova [40]: Go on, jump! You can do it!

Nova [50]: Odds of making that jump are... you know what, let's not talk numbers. Let's say they're good. Pretty good.

Nova [60]: I think I saw the cub go that way. I'll add an extra waypoint for you.

Nova [70]: There's the cub. Go get him!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 03_Tree

Nova [10]: Damn! She blocked the path behind her! Okay! Think, Nova!

Nova [20]: Ooh! I can probably interface with that old sapping drill remotely. Stand back!

Nova [30]: Hey, that actually worked!

Nova [40]: Kill all those guys while I think. Vicarious murder always helps me think.

Nova [50]: We could... no, Nova, that wouldn't work. Keep killing, I'll think of something!

Nova [60]: The cub jumped down that hole! That must be the Demon Bear's lair!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_A

Nova [10]: You're definitely not alone down there! Hold on, I'll see if I can help.

Nova [20]: The Demon Bear sure has made itself comfortable in these ruins. Good luck with that.

Nova [30]: You're not getting back up the way you came. Maybe I can reach you with some of the leftover drilling equipment!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_A2

Nova [10]: Looks like it's really waiting for a hug. Go ahead! Hug it!

Nova [20]: Hug it. Come on. Look at that face.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_B

Nova [10]: I lost the Bear, but I'm picking up something new. Heads up.

Nova [20]: Picking up multiple lifeform signatures, and they're adorable. Watch out anyway!

Nova [30]: The Demon Bear is sending out her cubs! Get ready!

Nova [40]: More cubs incoming!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_C

Nova [10]: Those portals look stable...ish! Use them to your advantage!

Nova [20]: You should be able to use those portals yourself. Try to hold your breath, just in case.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_D

Nova [10]: The bear's back, and it's got some kind of energy shield this time!

Nova [20]: Heads up, the bear's back from the void! And with a shiny new coat.

Nova [30]: The bear has a shield now! Where'd it get that? I guess we'll never know!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_D2

Nova [10]: Her shield is too strong for a direct attack! Lure her upstairs and try to run her into the drills!

Nova [20]: That's not going to work. Try luring her into one of the drills upstairs!

Nova [30]: That shield is a problem. Trick her into charging at one of the drill-heads upstairs!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_E

Nova [10]: There's a fleet of automated drills still active! Stand on one of the activation pads on the second level so I know where to send them in!

Nova [20]: Look for the activation pads on the top level. I'll lock on to you and send in a drill!

Nova [30]: Activate a drill up top! If you can run the bear into it, that might be enough to weaken its shield!

Nova [40]: More drills ready! You know what to do!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_F

Nova [10]: One giant-ass drill coming right up! Or... down, I guess. Stay on that pad until the last second!

Nova [20]: Drill incoming! Stay on the pad to keep it spinning – but, you know, get out of the way of the bear.

Nova [30]: Locked on, stand by for drill.

Nova [40]: Got it! Drilling to your location!

Nova [50]: This is a drill! Ha!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_G

Nova [10]: That did it! She's vulnerable!

Nova [20]: Shield depleted! Go get her!

Nova [30]: It worked! Attack now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_G2

Nova [10]: That was a big hit, one more and that shield is toast!

Nova [20]: Great! One more hit like that should take care of that shield!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_G3

Nova [10]: It missed! The drill was deactivated too early! Stay on there as long as you can!

Nova [20]: That didn't work. I know it's scary, but you have to stay on that pad until the very last second!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_G4

Nova [10]: We need that bear to hit the drill at full power! Jump away right before she hits!

Nova [20]: Don't jump away too soon! There'll be enough time to escape before the bear hits, I promise.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_H

Nova [10]: Seismic readings are off the charts! Look out!

Nova [20]: Cave-in! Watch out for falling rocks!

Nova [30]: Cave-in imminent! Heads up!

Nova [40]: Try not to get crushed!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_I

Nova [10]: I don't want to freak you out or anything, but there's definitely ghosts down there. Like real, actual ghosts. Just letting you know!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_J

Nova [10]: Looks like some of the bear's cubs have grown up. Fend them off!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_K

Nova [10]: More Alphas inbound!

Nova [20]: Alpha bears coming in from the portals!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_L

Nova [10]: Looks like there's still some globs of voidsap down there. Don't let it touch you!

Nova [20]: That voidsap will do awful things if you get too close!

Nova [30]: Watch out for those globs of voidsap, it'll... well, let's just say you don't want to touch it.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 04_DemonBear_M

Nova [10]: Ouch! You need to jump away sooner!

Nova [20]: Try that again. We want the bear to hit the drill, not you!

Nova [30]: Jump out of the way sooner next time!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: 05_Loot

Nova [10]: Thanks for grabbing that. I'm detecting a teleporter down there – I'll send you a waypoint.

Nova [20]: There's the teleporter! And surrounded by loot! Handy, that. Activate the teleporter and you can come back and reinstall my core.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_A

Montana [10]: ...and the crab monster was actually the old groundskeeper the whole time! Boom! Killer twist, right?

Boldur [20]: Boldur knew it was the keeper of the grounds. It is always him.

WaterMonk [30]: What's a groundskeeper?

Shayne [40]: It's like a janitor, but for outside.

WaterMonk [50]: Yes. I also know what a janitor is.

Montana [60]: What's the deal? I thought you guys loved “The Insidious Crab of Thundernight Bay”. Oooohohohoh.

Shayne [70]: I'm just tired of bein' out in this dumb... nature. How long before Nova's fixed?

Montana [80]: Shouldn't be much more than – hey, you know what? I've got a story none of you have heard! And the craziest part? This one actually happened.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_B

Montana [10]: It all started when Nova said...

Nova [20]: Great job finding that lost pirate gold, Montana. I'll pick you up in that totally abandoned village. Be careful, we don't want to attract any Jennerit attention.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_C

Nova [10]: Montana, something's gone wrong. I've lost my processing core. I'm going down! Only you can save me.

WaterMonk [20]: Save her, Montana!

Thorn [30]: Child, it is not happening at this very moment.

WaterMonk [40]: Shh! I wanna hear what happens.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_D

Montana [10]: Suddenly, I was ambushed by Varelsi zombies!

WaterMonk [20]: Ahh!

Montana [30]: Sorry, didn't mean to scare you. Uh, I meant they were... robots!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_E

Montana [10]: That was when I heard the most butt-clenchingest sound imaginable. It was the howl... of the Demon Bear!

Montana [20]: “Rrrawwghgh!” Heh-heh-heh!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_F

Shayne [10]: Haha! Yeah! Eat it, library!

Montana [20]: Hey! Reading is fun!

Thorn [30]: Thank you, Montana, it is good to see book club expanding your mind.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_G

Montana [10]: The Demon Bear, seeing my awesome might and righteous fury, ran away like a total sissy!

Boldur [20]: This is most un-bearlike behavior.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_H

Nova [10]: Tread carefully – they used to process voidsap in this refinery. You do NOT want any getting stuck to you.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_I

Montana [10]: I was finally ready to face my demons... both the actual bear, AND the metaphor and stuff.

Boldur [20]: Boldur getting bored! Fight now!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_J

Nova [10]: Get that core back! I need it for... things!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_K

Nova [10]: Grab my processing core and let's get out of here!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar01_L

Montana [10]: And that's how I saved Nova! Pretty sweet, right?

WaterMonk [20]: Wow! It all happened exactly like that?

Montana [30]: Kinda pretty much sorta, yeah!

Boldur [40]: Agh, you know NOTHING of bears! Boldur will tell the bear story next.

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_A

Montana [10]: Alright, Boldur. This is a team effort. If you didn't like my story, why don't you give it a go?

Boldur [20]: Good!

__________________________________________________________________________________________________

|| SECTION: Nar02_B
